commit_message:
Fix GET /v1/dataframes endpoint

When switching to DataFrames objects, a mistake has been made in the
DataFrameController object: the "resources" list was not emptied once a
dataframe was created, leading to a datapoint duplication in the command
output.

The bug hasn't been detected at that time, because each usage type in a
dataframe only contained a single data point. Gabbi fixtures have been
updated to include several points per dataframe and avoid a future
regression.

Change-Id: Ib41f0c91232ed06b82b6bb9f60ab316fc76e5209

subject: Never skip jobs when .zuul.yaml is changed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-07-21 21:55:11.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/68b0dc5bfa401e8059c8e9263ffbda88c354a0b7', 'message': "Never skip jobs when .zuul.yaml is changed

This is a partial revert of https://review.opendev.org/650138/

Currently it is possible to send a review which only touches
.zuul.yaml and changes the functional/tempest/grenade jobs
in a way that breaks them (for example, by removing 'voting: false',
or adding a new job of the said type, or altering their definition
with new parameters). Such changes would not be gated, thus
allowing it to be merged.

Change-Id: Id2b1476fbe0ae7bffd8f64e6f870bdc3721abbb8
"}]
commit_message:
Never skip jobs when .zuul.yaml is changed

This is a partial revert of https://review.opendev.org/650138/

Currently it is possible to send a review which only touches
.zuul.yaml and changes the functional/tempest/grenade jobs
in a way that breaks them (for example, by removing 'voting: false',
or adding a new job of the said type, or altering their definition
with new parameters). Such changes would not be gated, thus
allowing it to be merged.

Change-Id: Id2b1476fbe0ae7bffd8f64e6f870bdc3721abbb8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/47/671947/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Check node trait before creating server

Placement may fail to update trait because of Conflict
the trait may be updated by the Nova compute
update_available_resource periodic task.
We need node status is enabled, so we check the node
trait and delay if it is not the correct status.
the max delay time is 10 minutes.

Depends-on: Ie98e2c000568ecac63e8981a8b7087029c0d3705

Change-Id: I3e45d4a66a6e1bf55499def8550da38ddf01b638

added_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2019-08-25 07:06+0000\n""PO-Revision-Date: 2019-08-26 03:45+0000\n"msgid "OpenDev" msgstr "OpenDev" msgid "" "OpenDevs mission is to provide project hosting, continuous integration " "tooling, and virtual collaboration spaces for Open Source software projects. " "OpenDev is itself self hosted on this set of tools including code review, " "continuous integration, etherpad, wiki, code browsing and so on. This means " "that OpenDev itself is run like an open source project, you can join us and " "help run the system. Additionally, all of the services run are Open Source " "software themselves." msgstr "" "Misi OpenDev adalah untuk menyediakan hosting proyek, tooling integrasi " "berkesinambungan, dan ruang kolaborasi virtual untuk proyek perangkat lunak " "Open Source. OpenDev sendiri di-host di set alat ini termasuk tinjauan kode, " "integrasi berkelanjutan, etherpad, wiki, penelusuran kode, dan sebagainya. " "Ini berarti bahwa OpenDev sendiri dijalankan seperti proyek open source, " "Anda dapat bergabung dengan kami dan membantu menjalankan sistem. Selain " "itu, semua layanan yang dijalankan adalah perangkat lunak Open Source " "sendiri." msgid "The OpenStack project is the largest project using OpenDev." msgstr "Proyek OpenStack adalah proyek terbesar menggunakan OpenDev." msgid "" "Zuul is used for OpenStack development to ensure that only tested code gets " "merged." msgstr "" "Zuul digunakan untuk pengembangan OpenStack untuk memastikan bahwa hanya " "kode yang diuji yang digabung." "`OpenDev <https://opendev.org>`__ is a space for collaborative Open Source " "software development." msgstr "" "`OpenDev <https://opendev.org>`__ adalah ruang untuk pengembangan perangkat " "lunak Open Source kolaboratif." msgid ""msgid "" "`Zuul <https://zuul-ci.org>`__ is an open source CI/CD platform specializing " "in gating changes across multiple systems and applications before landing a " "single patch." msgstr "" "`Zuul <https://zuul-ci.org>`__ adalah open source CI/CD platform yang " "mengkhususkan diri dalam perubahan gating di beberapa sistem dan aplikasi " "sebelum mendarat patch tunggal."

commit_message:
Create ansible environment variables in profile.d

This change sets our desired ansible options as default environment variables
on systems where the `tripleo-bootstrap` role is executed. This change will
ensure all of our ansible resources are accessible by users of the system,
using the default shell, and are executed in an expected way, mirroring what
we setup within our mistral ansible configuration file.

Change-Id: If5a997dc2698dc286e118289431cc441e3c03199
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I8bc8df70fad41afc5ccc7a6b4834595d55857db6
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Generate an unique prefix for each config worker

Make sure each MP worker executed by the container-puppet tool
holds a unique name. This removes race conditions, when multiple
workers configure the same config volume of a service.

Change-Id: I8bc8df70fad41afc5ccc7a6b4834595d55857db6
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Use promote for publishing

Switch to using a promote job instead of a post job for publishing. This
avoids an extra run after release.

commit_message:
Rebase api-guide/ref jobs

We based these jobs on opendev-tox-docs since openstack-tox-docs was
migrated later to promote jobs. Switch them back to openstack-tox-docs
so that requirements are set up correctly.

Disable PDF building for these for now.

Change-Id: I1d17858e15c4934cd9625ec31cde7a095aac26a0

commit_message:
Update api-ref location

The api documentation is now published on docs.openstack.org instead
of developer.openstack.org. Update all links that are changed to the
new location.

Note that redirects will be set up as well but let's point now to the
new location.

For details, see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-July/007828.html

Change-Id: Ib3bf99b1fcb81d70aae3125734b3fe21e6b1aa5b

commit_message:
Remove now obsolete publish jobs

The deploy-guide and contributor-guide jobs are now unused since
switching to promote jobs. Remove them and the playbook that is not
shared.

Use unique names in promote.yaml (copying over
https://review.opendev.org/677662)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/677803
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/677802
Change-Id: I0c18f0b5aeeabdf40a86627a8f003969dd428151

commit_message:
Drop creating extra endpoints in devstack

We don't need admin or internal endpoints in a normal devstack setup,
other basic projects are also only creating the public endpoint now.

Change-Id: Iaafec07cf9a0196b5da850924b98e3aa94d559f1

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/57/678457/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: List all database backups information for a project. You can filter results by using query string parameters. The following filters are supported: - ``instance_id={instance_id}`` - Return the list of backups for a particular database instance. - ``all_projects`` - Return the list of backups for all the projects, this is admin only param by default.List all database backups for the specified instance. This is equivalent to ``GET /v1.0/{accountId}/backups?instance_id={instanceId}``.
deleted_lines: List all database backups information for a tenant.List all database backups for the specified instance.

commit_message:
worker: Re-add FailoverPreparationForAmphora

This tasks removes the dns_name option from ports, so that they can be
plugged into a new amphora, which has a different name. This was lost in
change I04d267bd3cdedca11f0350c5255086233cba14ec.

Story: 2006205
Task: 35791

Conflicts:

commit_message:
worker: Re-add FailoverPreparationForAmphora

This tasks removes the dns_name option from ports, so that they can be
plugged into a new amphora, which has a different name. This was lost in
change I04d267bd3cdedca11f0350c5255086233cba14ec.

Story: 2006205
Task: 35791

Conflicts:
    octavia/controller/worker/v1/flows/amphora_flows.py

Change-Id: I4230feae5b6f0778b738bddbc69c5a0cd3e6930c
Signed-off-by: Sven Wegener <sven.wegener@inovex.de>
(cherry picked from commit c4c7387f8904075b961612b5a08aff47c51c081c)

commit_message:
Parse the new PCI request from flavor extra specs when resize

When resize instance, the new flavor may includes new PCI requests.
This patch will parse those PCI requests from flavor and merge
those request with existed SRIOV pci requests.

Change-Id: Id8bc7c57e28b63fa1e6b3d3a6407d6db6d123c4e
Closes-Bug: #1805767
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/77/621077/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: new_pci_requests = instance.pci_requests new_pci_requests = pci_request.get_pci_requests_from_flavor( new_instance_type) new_pci_requests.instance_uuid = instance.uuid # PCI requests come from two sources: instance flavor and # SR-IOV ports. SR-IOV ports pci_request don't have an alias_name. # On resize merge the SR-IOV ports pci_requests with the new # instance flavor pci_requests. if instance.pci_requests: for request in instance.pci_requests.requests: if request.alias_name is None: new_pci_requests.requests.append(request) request_spec.pci_requests = new_pci_requests

commit_message:
Add functional tests for persistent memory

Change-Id: I194315ca1b0c9b93302704b9809f233841a421b6
Partially-Implements: blueprint virtual-persistent-memory
Co-Authored-By: He Jie Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/92/675592/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock import time from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log as logging from nova import context as nova_context from nova import objects from nova.tests.functional.libvirt import base from nova.tests.unit.virt.libvirt import fakelibvirt from nova.virt.libvirt import device as libvirt_device CONF = cfg.CONF LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class PMEMTestBase(base.ServersTestBase): # the minimum libvirt version needed for pmem MIN_LIBVIRT_PMEM_SUPPORT = 5000000 MIN_QEMU_PMEM_SUPORT = 3001000 ADMIN_API = True def setUp(self): super(PMEMTestBase, self).setUp() self.flags(pmem_namespaces="4GB:ns_0,SMALL:ns_1|ns_2", group='libvirt') self.fake_pmem_namespaces = ''' [{"dev":"namespace0.0", "mode":"devdax", "map":"mem", "size":4292870144, "uuid":"24ffd5e4-2b39-4f28-88b3-d6dc1ec44863", "daxregion":{"id": 0, "size": 4292870144,"align": 2097152, "devices":[{"chardev":"dax0.0", "size":4292870144}]}, "name":"ns_0", "numa_node":0}, {"dev":"namespace0.1", "mode":"devdax", "map":"mem", "size":4292870144, "uuid":"ac64fe52-de38-465b-b32b-947a6773ac66", "daxregion":{"id": 0, "size": 4292870144,"align": 2097152, "devices":[{"chardev":"dax0.1", "size":4292870144}]}, "name":"ns_1", "numa_node":0}, {"dev":"namespace0.2", "mode":"devdax", "map":"mem", "size":4292870144, "uuid":"2ff41eba-db9c-4bb9-a959-31d992568a3e", "raw_uuid":"0b61823b-5668-4856-842d-c644dae83410", "daxregion":{"id":0, "size":4292870144, "align":2097152, "devices":[{"chardev":"dax0.2", "size":4292870144}]}, "name":"ns_2", "numa_node":0}]''' _p = mock.patch( 'nova.virt.libvirt.LibvirtDriver._get_local_gb_info', return_value={'total': 128, 'used': 44, 'free': 84}) self.mock_get_local_gb_info = _p.start() self.addCleanup(_p.stop) _p = mock.patch('nova.privsep.libvirt.cleanup_pmem') self.mock_cleanup_pmem = _p.start() self.addCleanup(_p.stop) _p = mock.patch( 'nova.privsep.libvirt.get_pmem_namespaces', return_value=self.fake_pmem_namespaces) self.mock_get_pmem_namespaces = _p.start() self.addCleanup(_p.stop) def _assert_pmem_equal(self, expected, actual): for field in ['label', 'name', 'dev', 'size', 'align', 'instance_uuid']: self.assertEqual(getattr(expected, field), getattr(actual, field)) def _assert_pmem_list_equal(self, expected, actual): self.assertEqual(len(expected), len(actual)) for expect_pmem in expected: for actual_pmem in actual: if expect_pmem.name == actual_pmem.name: self._assert_pmem_equal(expect_pmem, actual_pmem) def _wait_for_state_change(self, server, expected_status): for i in range(0, 50): server = self.api.get_server(server['id']) if server['status'] == expected_status: return server time.sleep(.1) self.assertEqual(expected_status, server['status']) return server class PMEMTests(PMEMTestBase): def setUp(self): super(PMEMTests, self).setUp() def test_create_servers_with_pmem(self): """Verify the pmem device claim and unclaim. 1) create two servers, ensure claim vgpus correctly. 2) delete one of server, ensure unclaim vgpu correctly. 3) restart the nova-compute, ensure the re-populate the existing pmems correctly. 4) create a server with many PMEM, but can't satisfy the request. ensure no pmem claim for it. """ ctx = nova_context.get_admin_context() fake_connection = self._get_connection( # We need more RAM or the 3rd server won't be created host_info=fakelibvirt.HostInfo(kB_mem=8192), libvirt_version=self.MIN_LIBVIRT_PMEM_SUPPORT) self.mock_conn.return_value = fake_connection self.compute = self.start_service('compute', host='compute1') device_manager = self.compute.driver._device_manager # Ensure populating the existing pmems correctly. expected_pmem_list = [ libvirt_device.PMEMDevice( label='4GB', name='ns_0', dev='dax0.0', size=4292870144, align=2097152), libvirt_device.PMEMDevice( label='SMALL', name='ns_1', dev='dax0.1', size=4292870144, align=2097152), libvirt_device.PMEMDevice( label='SMALL', name='ns_2', dev='dax0.2', size=4292870144, align=2097152)] self._assert_pmem_list_equal( expected_pmem_list, device_manager._pmem_list) # now we boot two servers with pmem extra_spec = {"hw:pmem": "SMALL"} flavor_id = self._create_flavor(extra_spec=extra_spec) server_req = self._build_server(flavor_id) created_server1 = self.api.post_server({'server': server_req}) self._wait_for_state_change(created_server1, 'ACTIVE') created_server2 = self.api.post_server({'server': server_req}) self._wait_for_state_change(created_server2, 'ACTIVE') # Ensure the claim of pmem device correct. server1_obj = objects.Instance.get_by_uuid(ctx, created_server1['id']) server1_pmems = device_manager.get_claimed_devices_for_instance( server1_obj.uuid, server1_obj.instance_type_id, libvirt_device.PMEMDevice) self.assertEqual(1, len(server1_pmems)) server2_obj = objects.Instance.get_by_uuid(ctx, created_server2['id']) server2_pmems = device_manager.get_claimed_devices_for_instance( server2_obj.uuid, server2_obj.instance_type_id, libvirt_device.PMEMDevice) self.assertEqual(1, len(server2_pmems)) free_pmems = [pmem for pmem in device_manager._pmem_list if pmem.instance_uuid is None] self.assertEqual(1, len(free_pmems)) self.assertNotIn(set([pmem.name for pmem in free_pmems]), set([pmem.name for pmem in server1_pmems + server2_pmems])) # Delete one of servers, ensure the pmem unclaimed self.api.delete_server(created_server1['id']) self._wait_for_deletion(created_server1['id']) self.assertIsNone(server1_pmems[0].instance_uuid) free_pmems = [pmem for pmem in device_manager._pmem_list if not pmem.is_assigned] self.assertEqual(2, len(free_pmems)) # restart the compute server, ensure populate the existing pmems # correctly. self.compute = self.restart_compute_service(self.compute) device_manager = self.compute.driver._device_manager server2_pmems = device_manager.get_claimed_devices_for_instance( server2_obj.uuid, server2_obj.instance_type_id, libvirt_device.PMEMDevice) self.assertEqual(1, len(server2_pmems)) # now create a server with pmems we don't have extra_spec = {"hw:pmem": "4GB,6GB"} flavor_id = self._create_flavor(extra_spec=extra_spec) server_req = self._build_server(flavor_id) created_server3 = self.api.post_server({'server': server_req}) self._wait_for_state_change(created_server3, 'ERROR') # ensure the server3 didn't get any pmem. assigned_pmem = [pmem.instance_uuid for pmem in device_manager._pmem_list if pmem.is_assigned] self.assertEqual([created_server2['id']], assigned_pmem) class PMEMResizeTests(PMEMTestBase): def setUp(self): super(PMEMResizeTests, self).setUp() _p = mock.patch( 'nova.virt.libvirt.LibvirtDriver._get_instance_disk_info', return_value=[]) self.mock_disk_info = _p.start() self.addCleanup(_p.stop) _p = mock.patch('os.rename') self.rename = _p.start() self.addCleanup(_p.stop) _p = mock.patch( 'nova.virt.libvirt.LibvirtDriver._is_storage_shared_with', return_value=True) self.mock_is_storage_shared_with = _p.start() self.addCleanup(_p.stop) def _start_computes(self): # Start the first compute node. fake_connection = self._get_connection( # We need more RAM or the 3rd server won't be created host_info=fakelibvirt.HostInfo(kB_mem=8192), libvirt_version=self.MIN_LIBVIRT_PMEM_SUPPORT, hostname='compute1') self.mock_conn.return_value = fake_connection self.compute1 = self.start_service('compute', host='compute1') # Start the second compute node fake_connection = self._get_connection( # We need more RAM or the 3rd server won't be created host_info=fakelibvirt.HostInfo(kB_mem=8192), libvirt_version=self.MIN_LIBVIRT_PMEM_SUPPORT, hostname='compute2') self.mock_conn.return_value = fake_connection self.compute2 = self.start_service('compute', host='compute2') # Ensure populating the existing pmem correctly. for compute in (self.compute1, self.compute2): device_manager = compute.driver._device_manager # Ensure populating the existing pmems correctly. expected_pmem_list = [ libvirt_device.PMEMDevice( label='4GB', name='ns_0', dev='dax0.0', size=4292870144, align=2097152), libvirt_device.PMEMDevice( label='SMALL', name='ns_1', dev='dax0.1', size=4292870144, align=2097152), libvirt_device.PMEMDevice( label='SMALL', name='ns_2', dev='dax0.2', size=4292870144, align=2097152)] self._assert_pmem_list_equal( expected_pmem_list, device_manager._pmem_list) def test_resize_confirm_with_pmem(self): ctx = nova_context.get_admin_context() # Start two compute nodes self._start_computes() device_manager1 = self.compute1.driver._device_manager device_manager2 = self.compute2.driver._device_manager # now we boot two servers with pmem extra_spec = {"hw:pmem": "4GB"} flavor_id1 = self._create_flavor(extra_spec=extra_spec) server_req = self._build_server(flavor_id1) # force the host landing on compute1 server_req['availability_zone'] = 'nova:compute1' created_server = self.api.post_server({'server': server_req}) self._wait_for_state_change(created_server, 'ACTIVE') server_obj = objects.Instance.get_by_uuid(ctx, created_server['id']) server_pmems = device_manager1.get_claimed_devices_for_instance( server_obj.uuid, server_obj.instance_type_id, libvirt_device.PMEMDevice) self.assertEqual(1, len(server_pmems)) extra_spec = {"hw:pmem": "SMALL"} flavor_id2 = self._create_flavor(extra_spec=extra_spec) resize_req = { 'resize': { 'flavorRef': flavor_id2 } } self.api.api_post('/servers/%s/action' % created_server['id'], resize_req) self._wait_for_state_change(created_server, 'VERIFY_RESIZE') # Ensure we still have pmem claim on the source node old_flavor_id = objects.Flavor.get_by_flavor_id(ctx, flavor_id1).id server_old_pmems = device_manager1.get_claimed_devices_for_instance( server_obj.uuid, old_flavor_id, libvirt_device.PMEMDevice) self.assertEqual(1, len(server_pmems)) # Ensure we have new pmem claim on the target node new_flavor_id = objects.Flavor.get_by_flavor_id(ctx, flavor_id2).id server_new_pmems = device_manager2.get_claimed_devices_for_instance( server_obj.uuid, new_flavor_id, libvirt_device.PMEMDevice) self.assertEqual(1, len(server_new_pmems)) # Confirm resize confirm_resize_req = {'confirmResize': None} self.api.api_post('/servers/%s/action' % created_server['id'], confirm_resize_req) self._wait_for_state_change(created_server, 'ACTIVE') # Ensure unclaim on the source node server_old_pmems = device_manager1.get_claimed_devices_for_instance( server_obj.uuid, old_flavor_id, libvirt_device.PMEMDevice) self.assertEqual(0, len(server_old_pmems)) # Ensure we still have new pmem claim on the target node server_new_pmems = device_manager2.get_claimed_devices_for_instance( server_obj.uuid, new_flavor_id, libvirt_device.PMEMDevice) self.assertEqual(1, len(server_new_pmems)) @mock.patch('nova.compute.manager.ComputeVirtAPI.wait_for_instance_event') @mock.patch('nova.compute.manager.ComputeManager.' '_is_instance_storage_shared', return_value=True) def test_resize_revert_with_pmem(self, mock_is_instance_storage_shared, mock_wait_events): ctx = nova_context.get_admin_context() # Start two compute nodes self._start_computes() device_manager1 = self.compute1.driver._device_manager device_manager2 = self.compute2.driver._device_manager # now we boot a server with pmem. extra_spec = {"hw:pmem": "4GB"} flavor_id1 = self._create_flavor(extra_spec=extra_spec) server_req = self._build_server(flavor_id1) # force the host landing on compute1. server_req['availability_zone'] = 'nova:compute1' created_server = self.api.post_server({'server': server_req}) self._wait_for_state_change(created_server, 'ACTIVE') # ensure the server got 1 pmem. server_obj = objects.Instance.get_by_uuid(ctx, created_server['id']) server_old_pmems = device_manager1.get_claimed_devices_for_instance( server_obj.uuid, server_obj.instance_type_id, libvirt_device.PMEMDevice) self.assertEqual(1, len(server_old_pmems)) # create the flavor which resize to. extra_spec = {"hw:pmem": "SMALL"} flavor_id2 = self._create_flavor(extra_spec=extra_spec) resize_req = { 'resize': { 'flavorRef': flavor_id2 } } self.api.api_post('/servers/%s/action' % created_server['id'], resize_req) self._wait_for_state_change(created_server, 'VERIFY_RESIZE') # Ensure we still have pmem claim on the source node old_flavor_id = objects.Flavor.get_by_flavor_id(ctx, flavor_id1).id server_old_pmems = device_manager1.get_claimed_devices_for_instance( server_obj.uuid, old_flavor_id, libvirt_device.PMEMDevice) self.assertEqual(1, len(server_old_pmems)) # Ensure we have new pmem claim on the target node new_flavor_id = objects.Flavor.get_by_flavor_id(ctx, flavor_id2).id server_new_pmems = device_manager2.get_claimed_devices_for_instance( server_obj.uuid, new_flavor_id, libvirt_device.PMEMDevice) self.assertEqual(1, len(server_new_pmems)) # Revert resize confirm_resize_req = {'revertResize': None} self.api.api_post('/servers/%s/action' % created_server['id'], confirm_resize_req) self._wait_for_state_change(created_server, 'ACTIVE') # Ensure we still have pmem claim on the source node server_old_pmems = device_manager1.get_claimed_devices_for_instance( server_obj.uuid, old_flavor_id, libvirt_device.PMEMDevice) self.assertEqual(1, len(server_old_pmems)) # Ensure unclaim pmem on the dest host server_new_pmems = device_manager2.get_claimed_devices_for_instance( server_obj.uuid, new_flavor_id, libvirt_device.PMEMDevice) self.assertEqual(0, len(server_new_pmems))

commit_message:
Support instance creation and resize with pmems

* Parse the `hw:pmem` in flavor extra_spec to get pmems request
  and translate to resource request.

* Introduce claim/unclaim/purge_pmems into DeviceManager, so they
  will be called when claim/unclaim/purge_for_instance.

* Build xml with pmems if there are claimed pmems, all pmems will
  be put under guest numa node 0.

Change-Id: Ia56a361c06b0671d9fc2eda42be3cbbe517aaa52
Partially-Implements: blueprint virtual-persistent-memory
Co-Authored-By: He Jie Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/58/672958/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.virt.libvirt import device as libvirt_device @mock.patch.object(libvirt_device.DeviceManager, 'get_claimed_pmems') def test_get_guest_config_with_pmems(self, mock_claimed_pmems): drvr = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), True) instance_ref = objects.Instance(**self.test_instance) image_meta = objects.ImageMeta.from_dict(self.test_image_meta) mock_claimed_pmems.return_value = [ libvirt_device.PMEMDevice( label='4GB', name='ns_0', dev='dax0.0', size=4292870144, align=2097152, instance_uuid=instance_ref.uuid, flavor_id=instance_ref.flavor.id)] cfg = drvr._get_guest_config(instance_ref, _fake_network_info(self, 1), image_meta, {'mapping': {}}) for device in cfg.devices: if isinstance(device, vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestPMEM): self.assertEqual("nvdimm", device.model) self.assertEqual("/dev/dax0.0", device.source_path) break else: assert False, "Unable to find any pmem device for the guest."

commit_message:
Report pmem namespaces resources by provider tree

Get pmem namespaces info from device manager, and report
pmem namespaces resources to the provider tree. Custom
Resource Classes are used to represent PMEM namespace
resource here.

Change-Id: I729dce1c12a48c2f3599b4a16d6b2b90354db767
Partially-Implements: blueprint virtual-persistent-memory
Co-Authored-By: He Jie Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>

commit_message:
Populates existing pmems in libvirt device manager

DeviceManager is used to track all pmem namespaces and if
they are assigned or not. So when init_host, existing pmems
should be found and populated to device manager.

* Add one configuration option CONF.libvirt.pmem_namespaces:
  "$LABEL:$NSNAME[|$NSNAME][,$LABEL:$NSNAME[|$NSNAME]]"
  e.g. "128G:ns0|ns1|ns2|ns3,262144MB:ns4|ns5,MEDIUM:ns6|ns7"

* Introduce new PMEMDevice obj to contain pmem namespaces info.
  And use instance uuid and flavor id to mark that who it is
  assigned to.

* To ensure all pmems not assigned are clean, we check if there
  are any incomplete migrations to current host, and if yes,
  cleanup all unassigned pmem namespaces.

Change-Id: Ie926c58153a3dacf48314ca693fb847d81fd81a0
Partially-Implements: blueprint virtual-persistent-memory
Co-Authored-By: He Jie Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/57/672957/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import collections import nova.privsep.libvirt from nova import context as nova_context from nova import exception from nova.i18n import _ from nova import objects CONF = nova.conf.CONF class PMEMDevice(Device): def __init__(self, label=None, name=None, dev=None, size=None, align=None, instance_uuid=None, flavor_id=None): super(PMEMDevice, self).__init__(instance_uuid=instance_uuid, flavor_id=flavor_id) self.label = label self.name = name self.dev = dev self.size = size self.align = align self._pmem_list = [] def initialize(self, support_pmem=False): if support_pmem: self._populate_existing_pmems() self._unclaim_pmems(instance, flavor) def _populate_existing_pmems(self): """Populate all the existing pmems, and its assignment.""" pmems_by_name = self._driver._get_pmem_namespaces() assigned_pmems = self._driver._get_all_assigned_pmems() for name, pmem_info in pmems_by_name.items(): instance_uuid = assigned_pmems.pop(pmem_info.dev, None) self._pmem_list.append(PMEMDevice( label=pmem_info.label, name=pmem_info.name, dev=pmem_info.dev, size=pmem_info.size, align=pmem_info.align, instance_uuid=instance_uuid, flavor_id=None)) self._ensure_assigned_pmems_in_conf(assigned_pmems) if self._pmem_list: self._cleanup_pmems_for_incomplete_migrations() def _ensure_assigned_pmems_in_conf(self, pmems): if not pmems: return devs = ' '.join(pmems.keys()) reason = (_("PMEM devices %(devs)s are in use, but can not find " "corresponding namespaces configued in CONF") % {'devs': devs}) raise exception.PMEMNamespaceConfigInvalid(reason=reason) def _cleanup_pmems_for_incomplete_migrations(self): context = nova_context.get_admin_context() migration_filters = {'host': CONF.host, 'status': 'error'} migrations = objects.MigrationList.get_by_filters( context, migration_filters) for migration in migrations: if migration.dest_host == CONF.host: for pmem in self._pmem_list: if not pmem.is_assigned: self._cleanup_pmem(pmem) return def _cleanup_pmem(self, pmem): try: nova.privsep.libvirt.cleanup_pmem(pmem.dev) except Exception as e: raise exception.PMEMCleanupFailed(dev=pmem.dev, error=e)

commit_message:
Indroduce new LibvirtConfigGuestPMEM

Indroduce new LibvirtConfigGuestPMEM, which will be used
to format domain to xml or parse domain from xml for
persistent memory devices.

Change-Id: I6dfa9ac3e51e5e8456d7020b3ade7b78fa892dac
Partially-Implements: blueprint virtual-persistent-memory
Co-Authored-By: He Jie Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/56/672956/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class LibvirtConfigGuestPMEMTest(LibvirtConfigBaseTest): def test_config_pmem(self): obj = config.LibvirtConfigGuestPMEM( dev='dax0.0', size_kb=4096 * units.Ki, align_kb=2048) xml = obj.to_xml() self.assertXmlEqual(xml, """ <memory model='nvdimm' access="shared"> <source> <path>/dev/dax0.0</path> <alignsize>2048</alignsize> <pmem/> </source> <target> <size>4192256</size> <node>0</node> <label> <size>2048</size> </label> </target> </memory>""")

commit_message:
Remove disable_constraints

The change this depends on removes the nova and glance custom
constraint usage, so disable_constraints is no longer required.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/675204/
Change-Id: I691a8bbe17b4deb72ad3b996c0fdb43040a151a3

commit_message:
Remove get_by_id function

It seems that get_by_id() is not been used, so as the get()
function, delete them.

Change-Id: I023c263012d81e6a31d22fa44c34d717db17d0d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/77/415577/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def get(cls, context, x509keypair_id): """Find a X509KeyPair based on its id or uuid. Find X509KeyPair by id or uuid and return a X509KeyPair object. :param x509keypair_id: the id *or* uuid of a x509keypair. :param context: Security context :returns: a :class:`X509KeyPair` object. """ if strutils.is_int_like(x509keypair_id): return cls.get_by_id(context, x509keypair_id) elif uuidutils.is_uuid_like(x509keypair_id): return cls.get_by_uuid(context, x509keypair_id) else: raise exception.InvalidIdentity(identity=x509keypair_id) @base.remotable_classmethod def get_by_id(cls, context, x509keypair_id): """Find a X509KeyPair based on its integer id. Find X509KeyPair by id and return a X509KeyPair object. :param x509keypair_id: the id of a x509keypair. :param context: Security context :returns: a :class:`X509KeyPair` object. """ db_x509keypair = cls.dbapi.get_x509keypair_by_id(context, x509keypair_id) x509keypair = X509KeyPair._from_db_object(cls(context), db_x509keypair) return x509keypair @base.remotable_classmethod

Cluster coe-version should be fixed in command line

The 'coe-version' could be an optional parameter of command 'magnum cluster-create'.

Optimize the link address

Use https instead of http to ensure the safety without containing our
account/password information.Deleted some invalid URLs.

commit_message:
Validate router when user specify a existing router

Check the existence of router.
Check the router name to see if there is duplicate name. If so,
advise user to use network ID.

Partially Implements: blueprint specify-existing-router

Change-Id: I1545a91bcdb983a9f1ee1e1e09b5762d16d3d21b

commit_message:
Specify apiserver-count parameter for kube-apiserver

kubernetes apiserver should include --apiserver-count, if not specify,
1 is default. And the kubernetes service will only include a single
endpoint.
Same issue: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/22609

Change-Id: If3dd3bf5806c7c1f5a02ec0bc6c353578ccecd65

commit_message:
Use lb vip for etcd-servers

Currently kube-apiserver use 127.0.0.1:2379 for etcd-servers.
If etcd cluster have multiple etcd nodes, we should specify etcd
lb vip for etcd-servers to enable HA.

Change-Id: Ib4b2fa057e1cd46e56a41e2e697c3e2149f40b94

commit_message:
Improve devmode=flase when building the image

During debugging, the following changes are also included:

- Support to specify an image ID to run the integration test.
- Fix the reboot function bug.
- Remove the unsuccessful restart test.

How to run integration test with dev_mode=false:

    ADMIN_PASSWORD=password \
    SERVICE_PASSWORD=password \
    DEV_MODE=false \
    /opt/stack/trove/integration/scripts/trovestack gate-tests mysql mysql

Change-Id: I31d4ee579a554f4c98f9facb9fd4b7779665a3dd

Change-Id: Ief239e999601bbfed4c38f20ebe404b3bfb84055
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance-uc refs/changes/37/678437/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ======================== UC Elections September 2019 ======================== We expect all members of our community to adhere to the highest standards of behavior during User Committee elections. Officials ========= | Ian Y. Choi ianyrchoi at gmail dot com | Ed Leafe ed at leafe dot com Election System =============== Elections will be held using CIVS and a Condorcet algorithm (Schulze/Beatpath/CSSD variant). Any tie will be broken using `Governance/TieBreaking <https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Governance/TieBreaking>`_. Timeline ======== | August 26 - August 30, 05:59 UTC: Open candidacy for UC positions | September 1 - September 4, 11:59 UTC: UC elections (voting) Elected Positions ================= We need to elect 1 UC seat for this election. This seat is valid for one-year term. Electorate ========== The electorate for this election are the Foundation individual members that are also Active User Contributors (AUC) over the last six months. The electorate is requested to confirm their email address and (if applicable) IRC handle in their Foundation Member Profile, https://openstack.org/profile , prior to August 31, 2019 05:59 UTC so that the emailed ballots are mailed to the correct email address. Candidates ========== Any individual member of the Foundation who is an Active User Contributor (AUC) can propose their candidacy (except the three sitting UC members elected in the previous election). Self-nomination is common, no third party nomination is required. They do so by sending an email to the user-committee@lists.openstack.org mailing-list, with the subject: "UC candidacy" by August 31, 05:59 UTC. The email can include a description of the candidate platform. The candidacy is then confirmed by one of the election officials, after verification of the electorate status of the candidate. Results ======= | TBD

Change-Id: Ia58e7b7ae619b74fc0b6e7ebb544724e40da2350
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance-uc refs/changes/35/678435/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ======================== UC Elections September 2019 ======================== We expect all members of our community to adhere to the highest standards of behavior during User Committee elections. Officials ========= | Ian Y. Choi ianyrchoi at gmail dot com | Ed Leafe ed at leafe dot com Election System =============== Elections will be held using CIVS and a Condorcet algorithm (Schulze/Beatpath/CSSD variant). Any tie will be broken using `Governance/TieBreaking <https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Governance/TieBreaking>`_. Timeline ======== | August 26 - August 31, 05:59 UTC: Open candidacy for UC positions | September 2 - September 6, 11:59 UTC: UC elections (voting) Elected Positions ================= We need to elect 1 UC seat for this election. This seat is valid for one-year term. Electorate ========== The electorate for this election are the Foundation individual members that are also Active User Contributors (AUC) over the last six months. The electorate is requested to confirm their email address and (if applicable) IRC handle in their Foundation Member Profile, https://openstack.org/profile , prior to August 31, 2019 05:59 UTC so that the emailed ballots are mailed to the correct email address. Candidates ========== Any individual member of the Foundation who is an Active User Contributor (AUC) can propose their candidacy (except the three sitting UC members elected in the previous election). Self-nomination is common, no third party nomination is required. They do so by sending an email to the user-committee@lists.openstack.org mailing-list, with the subject: "UC candidacy" by August 31, 05:59 UTC. The email can include a description of the candidate platform. The candidacy is then confirmed by one of the election officials, after verification of the electorate status of the candidate. Results ======= | TBD

commit_message:
Docs: Fix broken links and make more robust

The following links are broken:
https://docs.openstack.org/designate/latest/contributor/sourcedoc/backends/djbdns_agent.html
https://docs.openstack.org/designate/latest/contributor/sourcedoc/backends/gdnsd_agent.html
https://docs.openstack.org/designate/latest/contributor/sourcedoc/backends/knot2_agent.html

Fix those.

Also, use in some places internal links instead of external ones to
make linking more robust against renames of files.

Change-Id: Ia4724f03e9bba1a6f05a8290b0eb31790ed9c715

subject: Add missing ostree admin init-fs call
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-01 08:22:39.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/drivers/common/image/fedora-atomic/finalise.d/80-fedora-atomic'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/8daccc8357a89b49b64057d4b32956e2c36a64e2', 'message': 'Add missing ostree admin init-fs call

Currently the 80-fedora-atomic fails with:
    error: opendir(ostree/repo): No such file or directory
The reason is, that the init-fs call is missing which creates
the needed directory hierarchy.

Change-Id: Ibd646e216b75ad069c678d10969f85b7c95b2ca7
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing ostree admin init-fs call

Currently the 80-fedora-atomic fails with:
    error: opendir(ostree/repo): No such file or directory
The reason is, that the init-fs call is missing which creates
the needed directory hierarchy.

Change-Id: Ibd646e216b75ad069c678d10969f85b7c95b2ca7
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

commit_message:
Modify test_pods_api to wait until the pod reaches status "Running"

We wait 1h max because we need to wait for the scheduler to be
running (needs hyperkube container) which can take more than 30mn
in non accelerated VMs, plus the pulling of nginx

Closes-Bug: 1645715
Change-Id: I6468af79c6151a57bacfbda3b11f2ffe2f27d86e

commit_message:
Add support for proxy and TLS to functional tests

Functional tests currently only support working with installations
based on devstack, not using TLS encryption on the endpoint, and having
direct connection to Internet. Tests are failing if these conditions
are not fulfilled. To provide a workaround, this commit adds 4 new
settings to functional_creds.conf file:

magnum.cacert - to set CA certificate for TLS endpoint
magnum.http_proxy - passed to http_proxy attribute of test cluster
magnum.https_proxy - passed to https_proxy attribute of test cluster
magnum.no_proxy - passed to no_proxy attribute of test cluster

Swarm test now pings DNS server, configured for a cluster. It defaults
to 8.8.8.8, but can be overridden. This is needed because outcoming
ICMP packets are often forbidden in corporate firewalls, so ping to
public DNS server 8.8.8.8 does not work.

Also, test for number of running services changed to verify that
at least one service is running. Installations other then devstack may
have more then one running conductor.

Change-Id: I0e2951efb2c03dd03ddebc90fe10e11e72430b5f

commit_message:
Support dcos installation on centos bm cluster

This patch provides support for installing dcos on centos using magnum.
A new coe type(dcos) is added. This provides support for baremetal.
Design spec and steps on how to test can be found in
contrib/drivers/dcos_centos_ironic_v1/README.md

Problems:
1. Public agent nodes are not supported now.
2. There are still some bugs when load balancer creation in heat
template.
See https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1635449

Co-Authored-By: vmud213 (vinay50muddu@yahoo.com)
Co-Authored-By: fengbeihong (fengbeihong@gmail.com)

Change-Id: Ib412e183838bf16eed790a0f0112554d1d72e3f9
Partially-Implements: blueprint mesos-dcos

commit_message:
Update api-ref to include the baymodel detail API

Magnum supports a 'detail' API to show the list of baymodel
or cluster templates with details but that is not mentioned
in our API doc.
So this patch updates the api-ref to include the details
of 'detail' API available for both cluster template and
baymodel.

Partial-Bug: #1674314

Change-Id: I06188f9d6e99ffee150f96b8c3782146ac24cee2

Install magnum with packstack

Add a document about installing magnum with packstack.

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/90/403490/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _install: ============================= Install Magnum With Pacstack ============================= Install and configure ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ This section describes how to install and configure the Container Infrastructure Management service, code-named magnum, on the controller node. Now the master branch of packstack has supported the installation of magnum. So we can deploy an openstack envirioment with packstack, in which magnum can be used. After the installation of openstack, we need do some configuration for magnum according to the devstack environment Packstack support magnum in <https://review.openstack.org/#/c/360388/>`__. .. important:: Only packstack master branch can support magnum installation. Install openstack ------------------ #. Installation of packstack: .. code-block:: console $ yum install -y git $ git clone git://github.com/openstack/packstack.git $ cd packstack && sudo python setup.py install #. Installation of openstack-puppet-modules: .. code-block:: console $ export GEM_HOME=/tmp/somedir $ gem install r10k $ sudo /tmp/somedir/bin/r10k puppetfile install -v $ sudo cp -r packstack/puppet/modules/packstack /usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules #. Install openstack services on a single host: .. code-block:: console $ packstack --allinone Config openstack ----------------- #. Add admin role for magnum in project services .. code-block:: console $ cd $ . keystonerc_admin $ openstack role add --project services --user magnum admin #. Create neutron resource .. code-block:: console $ TENENT=$(openstack project list | grep services | awk '{print $2}') $ neutron net-create public --router:external --provider:network_type=vxlan --tenant-id $TENENT $ neutron subnet-create --ip_version 4 --allocation-pool start=192.168.1.100,end=192.168.1.200 --name subnet1 --gateway 192.168.1.1 --tenant-id $TENENT public 192.168.1.1/24

commit_message:
Spec for adding template versions

This document covers the suggested addition of template versions.

Implements: blueprint template-versioning

Change-Id: I509e4cf52c22ff1cd565f38d46f5fcb8a40fd00e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/27/392327/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ================================= Add Template Versioning in Magnum ================================= Launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/magnum/+spec/template-versioning Magnum currently does not contain any method for versioning the templates that are used to create resources .i.e ClusterTemplates(CT) and NodeGroupTemplates(NGT). Template versions will provide operators better tools for using and maintaining templates within Magnum. Problem Description ------------------- Without template versions, operators must keep track of templates that are used to create resources within Magnum. Without versions it can be difficult to ensure updated Templates are used since older templates must remain if resources created with them exist. Also future desired features such as Cluster upgrades want to make use of versioned templates better control these updates. Use Cases --------- 1. Operators create a public ClusterTemplate to be used for creating Clusters. The operators want to be able to update the template without changing the name/uuid of the template while also tracking which version are still in use. 2. Operators want to delete a ClusterTemplate so that it cannot be used for new Clusters without having to wait until all existing Clusters that are using the template are deleted. 3. Operators want to be able to use life cycle commands like "upgrade" to trigger the Cluster to update itself to the latest version of the template it was created from. Proposed Changes ---------------- To allow for template versioning the following would be added to Magnum templates(such as ClusterTemplate): 4 new fields would be added to the template object: - version - parent_uuid - mark_for_deletion - obsolete Create ------ Template "create" operations would create a new template object and would set the new values as follows: version: 1 parent_uuid: <uuid of this object> mark_for_deletion: False obsolete: False Update ------ Template "update" operations would create a new template object and would set the new values as follows: version: <version value of template updated + 1> parent_uuid: <copy parent_uuid value from template updated> It would also set the obsolete value of the current version object being updated to True. Delete ------ Template "delete" operations would change the following on the objects: Current version obsolete: True Parent version mark_for_deletion: True Magnum will check if there are any active resources that reference any of the versions that have the parent_uuid of the template. If the version has no active resources referencing it then it will be deleted from the db. If all versions can be deleted then the parent version will be deleted as well. Magnum will also run this check on after any resource(Cluster/NodeGroup) delete to see if addition templates that are marked for deletion can be removed. List ---- When listing templates, only templates that are not marked obsolete will be listed. This will mean that only the latest version of each template will show up in the list. Note: if desired a new flag could be added to list all templates included those versions that are obsolete. Show ---- When showing a template, the latest version of the template will be displayed. If desired, a new flag could be added to specify a version to allow viewing older templates that may still exist. Resource Create --------------- When using a template to create a resource the latest version of the template will always be used. If all versions are obsolete in the case of a deletion, a resource cannot be created using that template. Data model impact ----------------- 4 new attributes will be added to each template object: - version - parent_uuid - mark_for_deletion - obsolete REST API impact --------------- Possible new flags for showing previous versions. See List and Show sections above. Alternative Implementation Option --------------------------------- Another way to implement this feature would be to create a TemplateParent Object. This object would store the latest information about Template and reference the template objects for each version. TemplateParent - TemplateName - uuid - latestVersion - is_deleted - {<version>: <Template object ref>, ...} Overall, versions would work the same as above this object would be the main source of linking Templates to versions. Create ------ TemplateParent would be created. A Template object would also be created. A reference to the template object would be added to the TemplateParent attached to version 1. Update ------ A new Template object would be created. A reference to that object would be added to the version list with version equal to latest+1. Delete ------ Flag for is_deleted would be set true in the TemplateParent. The template will no longer be valid for new resource creation. If all resources referencing any version in the TemplateParent are deleted then the TemplateParent and listed template objects will be deleted from database. Security impact --------------- Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation -------------- Dependencies ------------ Testing ------- Documentation Impact -------------------- Documentation will need to be updated to show how versioning will work for templates. References ---------- None

commit_message:
Updated spec for trusts

This commit updates the spec for trustee users with an
approach that reduces the privileges granted to trustee users
to the minimum required. Summary:

* Allow authenticated users in Magnum domain to perform
  certificate operations without any roles. This way a trust
  is unneccessary for these operations.
* Only create trust for clusters that use Rexray to access the
  Cinder API or that create their own registry.

Change-Id: Ie8eab5ac3a324a2d0d4dd7756632da456bff2dee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/55/389755/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mechanism. Since the trustee user has wide ranging acccess, its use should be limited to bays that actually need it, i.e. those listed in the Use Cases section.so we need to pass user credentials into the vms. Additionally, Magnum's periodic task needs to access the Heat API on the user's behalf, even after the token used to create the bay has expired.5. Magnum's periodic task needs to access the Heat API to synchronize bay status with stack status. nothing in Openstack. The trustee user's name consists of (a) the bay's UUID and (b) the bay's project, separated by an underscore ('_'). Magnum uses this information to associate it with both as needed, specifically for filtering by project when retrieving the bay and baymodel from the database. This is used solely for the purposes of certificate operations [6]_. The restriction to certificate operations is enforced by policy settings in `policy.json`. 2. Define a trust relationship between the trustor and the Magnum service user ("service trust"). The Magnum service user will use this trust for (a) its periodic task and (b) removing all trusts created for the bay in question upon bay deletion. 3. If needed for the bay in question, define a trust relationship between the trustor and the trustee ("cluster trust"). The trustor can delegate a limited set of roles to the trustee. We can add an option named trust_roles in baymodel. Users can add roles which they want to delegate into trust_roles. If trust_roles is not provided, we delegate all the roles to the trustee. The trust is only delegated in cases where existing OpenStack objects need to be manipulated, e.g. for attaching Cinder volumes from inside an existing instance that requests them to be attached [5]_. 4. For services that only need to create new resources and can access them without needing knowledge of or manipulations to existing resources a per-bay project is created in the dedicated domain. The trustee user gets the role configured in `[trust/cluster_role]` assigned as its one and only role on that project. It is free to create and delete resources inside this project. 5. Services in the bay can access Magnum's certificate API with just the trustee user's credentials. They can perform operations requiring manipulation of existing OpenStack resources, such as attaching Cinder volumes with these credentials and the trust ID they only get as required. They can perform operations limited to resources they create themselves (e.g. Swift containers) in a dedicated project if they need that. The extra privileges detailed in (3) and (4) are only granted if the bay's underlying baymodel requires them. Specifically for `volume_driver=rexray` in swarm based bays and `registry_enabled=true`, respectively, for all bays. The roles which are delegated to the trustee should be limited. Likewise, the trust's endpoint limitation should be used: If the services in the bay only need access to Neutron, we should not allow the services to access to other OpenStack services. But there is a limitation that a trustor must have the role which is delegated to a trustee [4]_.Trustee id, trustee password trust id and service trust id are added to Bay table in Magnum database.
deleted_lines: mechanism.so we need to pass user credentials into the vms. nothing in Openstack. 2. Define a trust relationship between the trustor and the trustee. The trustor can delegate a limited set of roles to the trustee. We can add an option named trust_roles in baymodel. Users can add roles which they want to delegate into trust_roles. If trust_roles is not provided, we delegate all the roles to the trustee. 3. Services in the bay can access OpenStack services with the trustee credentials and the trust. The roles which are delegated to the trustee should be limited. If the services in the bay only need access to Neutron, we should not allow the services to access to other OpenStack services. But there is a limitation that a trustor must have the role which is delegated to a trustee [4]_.Trustee id, trustee password and trust id are added to Bay table in Magnum database.

commit_message:
Fix build warning in c codes

There are some build warning observed when building c codes.
It is not critical as they are still warning, but it would be
better to avoid these warning if possible.

Trivial-fix
Change-Id: I5f89fc0defce43984471576025636e172630e733

commit_message:
Move reproducer README file

when trying to use reproducer generator stand standalone, README file is taken
from collect logs.
This change moves it to the create reproducer role, and make it a standard
file, not a template, since it does not use any variable

Change-Id: Ie21f47264680b468ce51a3e1f8305670889ccb41

commit_message:
tripleo-ci-base: disable ara generate html

This change disables the ara html generation as it doesn't seems to work.
Instead the ansible-role-collect-logs will create ara-report directory
that should be served by the ara middleware.

Change-Id: Ic49bc509583f87f391fe9cc7788ecb77c5bb09e5

commit_message:
remove 1831866 from the skip list

commit_message:
Support backup filtering

To get all the backups of an instance:

    openstack database backup list --instance-id <instance-id>

Admin user gets backups of all the projects:

    openstack database backup list --all-projects

Story: #2006433
Task: #36346
Change-Id: I871d1ffa27805158024e8ecbe1dceae725c4deac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-troveclient refs/changes/09/678409/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def list(self, limit=None, marker=None, datastore=None, instance_id=None, all_projects=False): """Get a list of all backups.""" query_strings["datastore"] = datastore if instance_id: query_strings["instance_id"] = instance_id if all_projects: query_strings["all_projects"] = True
deleted_lines: def list(self, limit=None, marker=None, datastore=None): """Get a list of all backups. :rtype: list of :class:`Backups`. """ query_strings = {'datastore': datastore}

commit_message:
Adjust for bp:remove-pool-group-totally

the zaqar service started  refusing to handle the group
parameter with the error message:

"Additional properties are not allowed (u'group' was unexpected)"

Also pool_group was removed. the server change is
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/628723/15

which is related to http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/zaqar-specs/specs/stein/remove-pool-group-totally.html

Change-Id: I7aac8b53115ff2380e3597b5a940d3899b416c6e
Closes-Bug: #1839614

commit_message:
Add a flag to create the reproducer script

Your local setup should be able to give you a copy of the
reproducer-quickstart.sh script.  This is useful when you don't want to go
hunting for a ci job which might have one, e.g. when creating new OVB
environments.

Change-Id: Ia72fa237cc91f9b23e8554b90c62b62976e3f1cf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/43/586843/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo " -a, --create-reproducer" echo " Create the reproducer-quickstart.sh script" --create-reproducer) CREATE_REPRODUCER=1 ;; if [ "$CREATE_REPRODUCER" = 1 ]; then ansible-playbook -$VERBOSITY \ -e local_working_dir=$OPT_WORKDIR \ -e nodes_config=/config/nodes/3ctlr_1comp.yml \ -e toci_jobtype=ovb-3ctlr_1comp-featureset001 \ /dev/stdin <<END --- - hosts: localhost roles: - role: create-reproducer-script END exit fi

commit_message:
Compensate for network problems in build-test-packages

This change adds a retry mechanism for temporary network failure, and a fallback mechanism with which we can specify an alternate host to try to get stuff from in case the first url is completely down

Closes-Bug: #1791941

Change-Id: Iffdf4e47e3bd23ad092faade799e2d23ba7bd085

commit_message:
Fail build-test-package if project not found

When build-test-package cannot find one of the projects from the reviews
and is not an skipped project it has to fail so we don't have partial repos.

Test reviews:
https://review.rdoproject.org/r/18892
Test build-test-packages RPM and non-RPM

https://review.rdoproject.org/r/18891
Test build-test-packages one review good one bad

Closes-Bug: #1815744

Change-Id: Ia79039cbe139053ab7133749a70f28c1d80d40e7

commit_message:
Remove overcloud image download during prep images

This commit removes the overcloud image download ability to the prep
images role, since there's no need to do it here while we already have a
role dedicated to that (fetch-images, in tripleo-quickstart) and it
might confuse users.

Change-Id: Iaf0ade7c103b800b70f1db964d7ed41501ef9657

commit_message:
WIP: Update default for THT resource registry

The default resource registry in THT should be the templated one
(overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml) rather than
environments/docker.yaml.

Setting this as WIP, because it might only be a valid default
starting on some release and needs testing.

Change-Id: Ic98f4f6cf6337d477a56494d9fa6e7644ae524f1

subject: add delorean-current to repolist for updates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-17 03:13:05.000000000', 'files': ['roles/undercloud-deploy/templates/containers-prepare-parameter.yaml.j2', 'roles/overcloud-prep-containers/templates/overcloud-prep-containers.sh.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/6f537a9684fe8861d7b09222ff2bb63789aa0365', 'message': 'add delorean-current to repolist for updates

The list of containers that are updated are generated
from a list of rpms from the gating repo.  These
containers are updated w/ the gating repo and dlrn-current.

That makes the above set of containers out of sync w/
the rest of the containers.  The list of containers
that are updated needs to include changes required
by dlrn-current AND the gating repo.

fix if statement w/ mixed_upgrade

Related-Bug #1786764

Change-Id: Iea3e787679c54194e0028028ac1b202ddb929155

commit_message:
add delorean-current to repolist for updates

The list of containers that are updated are generated
from a list of rpms from the gating repo.  These
containers are updated w/ the gating repo and dlrn-current.

That makes the above set of containers out of sync w/
the rest of the containers.  The list of containers
that are updated needs to include changes required
by dlrn-current AND the gating repo.

fix if statement w/ mixed_upgrade

Related-Bug #1786764

Change-Id: Iea3e787679c54194e0028028ac1b202ddb929155

commit_message:
ovb-manage: Allow the use of localhost as undercloud part of the stack

In upstream OVB tests, the undercloud is usually created by nodepool, then the
current tooling creates an OVB environment using the existing undercloud
This change adds this kind of behaviour to the role

Change-Id: Ia0205624219d024d9226af6681932e79f0df6374

commit_message:
ovb-manage: stop carrying password around

This change generates a token at the start of the role from username and
password, then offers a credentials file, with ONLY the token to be used by the
cli calls in the tasks.

Change-Id: Ifd6b28ffeba4c7a3bad7bc388371b97a55fae2c6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/72/584372/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: get token from credentials os_auth: auth: username: {{ os_username }} password: {{ os_password }} auth_url: {{ os_auth_url }} project_name: {{ os_project_name }} when: os_auth_token|default("") == "" - name: generate credentials file template: src: credentials.sh.j2 dest: {{ credentials_file }} - name: remove credentials_file file: state: absent path: {{ credentials_file }}

commit_message:
export OVERCLOUD_HOSTS when running enable-ssh-admin.sh

enable-ssh-admin.sh requires OVERCLOUD_HOSTS to be available per
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/tree/
deployed-server/scripts/enable-ssh-admin.sh#n40
This change exports the var before running enable-ssh-admin.sh
so the tripleo-admin user gets created on the overcloud and is
available for subsequent operations such as upgrade.

Related-Bug: 1772121

Change-Id: I369996b5568a88d5eda4bb151852ac719ba99a7d

commit_message:
turn ironic automated_clean off

The ovb jobs running in rdo-cloud are often failing
in overcloud_prep_images.  The details are in the bug,
however the cleaning of nodes is not required and
causing additional risk of the job failing.

https://access.redhat.com/solutions/3349081

Closes-Bug: #1792872
Change-Id: Ib6ae898ade97dd41b627cdab4b1edbd8b47b0e93

commit_message:
Run emit_releases_file.py for all featuresets

This is needed in case we want  to do stuff like
cleanup QUICKSTART_RELEASE, and UPGRADE_RELEASE
variables, and also cleanup the upgrade bash code
from toci, to do bigger refactorings.

This is part of the card at [1]

[1] https://trello.com/c/DdSHkgnE/884-replace-tocijobtype-variable-s17-undercloud-playbooks-environment-tags

To test this we have to do the same stuff we do
at the noop changes:

master: 	https://review.openstack.org/589383
stable/queens: 	https://review.openstack.org/589380
stable/pike: 	https://review.openstack.org/589381

Change-Id: Ic076ea5f6c697fc89dd97885d3a12bdf9978d35b

commit_message:
Add a full upgrades job for featureset056

Adding this new upgrades job -full to run a full
upgrade path (rocky to master) as the opposite of
the normal job ( -upgrades) which will run a master
to master upgrade

Change-Id: If80d9bdc53f097b77f35080566fe9c3368f93b1b
Depends-On: I6e64f39e44eaf22b9402862e93613eb107bf26c8

commit_message:
Add new featureset for a rocky to master jobs

While we are moving the featureset051 to a simple
master to master job, to get it voting, this review
creates a new featureset that aim to run the normal
upgrade: release -1 to release.
This kind of job might be unstable and hit timeout, so
it will probably stay to non-voting, rather than the 051
aim to be voting.

Change-Id: I6e64f39e44eaf22b9402862e93613eb107bf26c8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/71/608271/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Summary of the feature set. # Deploy a containerized Openstack environment using the keystone-only # scenario (scenario000) and upgrade it undercloud_setup: true overcloud_ipv6: false # pacemaker settings are configured in the scenario template # do not set `enable_pacemaker` in the featureset # Container prep parameters. containerized_overcloud: true containerized_overcloud_upgrade: true enable_opstools_repo: true undercloud_generate_service_certificate: false ssl_overcloud: false step_introspect: false composable_scenario: scenario000-multinode-containers.yaml upgrade_composable_scenario: scenario000-multinode-containers.yaml deployed_server: true test_ping: false run_tempest: false # save time by doing a mixed upgrade mixed_upgrade: true # Tripleo-upgrade role parameters # Major Upgrade: containers -> containers (keystone-only) overcloud_upgrade: true # disable tripleo-upgrade container manipulation. create_docker_registry: false use_local_docker_registry: false create_container_images_download_script: false # Need to update once stein is released container_registry_file: >- {% if release not in ['ocata','pike','queens','rocky'] -%} containers-prepare-parameter.yaml {%- else -%} containers-default-parameters.yaml {%- endif -%} tripleo_ci: true use_oooq: true tripleo_upgrade_debug: true overcloud_ssh_user: "tripleo-admin" # Mandatory for deployed_servers tripleo_upgrade_validations_non_fatal: true # Reduce CI wall time tripleo_upgrade_converge_plan_only: true # Use release-1 templates for overcloud deploy in case # of mixed_upgrade jobs. overcloud_templates_path: "{{ working_dir }}/tripleo-heat-templates" overcloud_templates_repo: https://git.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates overcloud_templates_branch: stable/{{ release }} # options below direct automatic doc generation by tripleo-collect-logs artcl_gen_docs: true artcl_create_docs_payload: included_deployment_scripts: - undercloud-install - overcloud-custom-tht-script - overcloud-prep-containers - overcloud-prep-flavors - overcloud-prep-images - overcloud-prep-network - overcloud-deploy - overcloud-deploy-post - overcloud-upgrade - overcloud-validate included_static_docs: - env-setup-virt table_of_contents: - env-setup-virt - undercloud-install - overcloud-custom-tht-script - overcloud-prep-containers - overcloud-prep-flavors - overcloud-prep-images - overcloud-prep-network - overcloud-deploy - overcloud-deploy-post - overcloud-upgrade - overcloud-validate composable_roles: true overcloud_roles: - name: Controller CountDefault: 1 tags: - primary - controller networks: - External - InternalApi - Storage - StorageMgmt - Tenant config_download_args: >- {% if overcloud_release is defined and overcloud_release in ['queens'] -%} --no-config-download {%- endif -%} containerized_undercloud: >- {% if release not in ['newton','ocata','pike','queens'] -%} true {%- else -%} false {%- endif -%} undercloud_custom_env_files: "{{ working_dir }}/undercloud-parameter-defaults.yaml" undercloud_cloud_domain: "localdomain" undercloud_undercloud_hostname: "undercloud.{{ undercloud_cloud_domain }}" undercloud_resource_registry_args: "OS::TripleO::Undercloud::Net::SoftwareConfig": "{{ undercloud_templates_path }}/ci/common/net-config-simple-bridge.yaml"

commit_message:
WIP: Link subnodes-setup into multinode jobs.

A new playbook subnode-setup has been added in
which the overcloud instance repositories and
packages are configured taking the release file
defined in OVERCLOUD_DEPLOY_RELEASE var from
releases.sh.
This way, we ensure the right repositories are
configured independently if it's an mixed versions
job or not.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/607846
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/607833
Related-Bug: #1791115
Change-Id: Ic7ba189256d28818d4048f5b942737756542ec95

Generate list of commands to run in job, while other preparement
work is moved to pre.yml. Run only CI playbooks using file
playbook_executions.sh where all variables are loaded and all

commit_message:
DNM: Run only CI playbooks in run.yml zuul playbook

Generate list of commands to run in job, while other preparement
work is moved to pre.yml. Run only CI playbooks using file
playbook_executions.sh where all variables are loaded and all
playbooks are running.
This file could be useful for custom local deployments, where
running playbooks one by one with customizations.
Saves 5 minutes for every job.

Change-Id: Ieebf477e4cb03d8b8c3c2460cd4a73b083a3c480
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/40/565740/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function generate_playbook_command { local playbook=$1 echo "$QUICKSTART_INSTALL_CMD \ --extra-vars ci_job_end_time=$(( START_JOB_TIME + REMAINING_TIME*60 )) \ $LOCAL_WORKING_DIR/playbooks/$playbook \"${PLAYBOOKS_ARGS[$playbook]:-}\" \ 2>&1 | tee -a $LOGS_DIR/quickstart_install.log && exit_value=0 || exit_value=$?" } function dumpvars { cat<<EOF > ~/oooq_internal_vars.sh export ANSIBLE_CONFIG=$ANSIBLE_CONFIG export ANSIBLE_SSH_ARGS=$ANSIBLE_SSH_ARGS export ARA_DATABASE=$ARA_DATABASE export DEFAULT_ARGS=$DEFAULT_ARGS export DEVSTACK_GATE_TIMEOUT=$DEVSTACK_GATE_TIMEOUT export LOCAL_WORKING_DIR=$LOCAL_WORKING_DIR export LOGS_DIR=$LOGS_DIR export NODEPOOL_PROVIDER=$NODEPOOL_PROVIDER export NODES_FILE=$NODES_FILE export OOOQ_DIR=$OOOQ_DIR export OPT_WORKDIR=$OPT_WORKDIR export PLAYBOOKS_ARGS=$PLAYBOOKS_ARGS export QUICKSTART_COLLECTLOGS_CMD=$QUICKSTART_COLLECTLOGS_CMD export QUICKSTART_INSTALL_CMD=$QUICKSTART_INSTALL_CMD export QUICKSTART_RELEASE=$QUICKSTART_RELEASE export QUICKSTART_VENV_CMD=$QUICKSTART_VENV_CMD export REMAINING_TIME=$REMAINING_TIME export SSH_CONFIG=$SSH_CONFIG export STABLE_RELEASE=$STABLE_RELEASE export START_JOB_TIME=$START_JOB_TIME export STATS_OOOQ=$STATS_OOOQ export STATS_TESTENV=$STATS_TESTENV export TOCI_JOBTYPE=$TOCI_JOBTYPE export VIRTUAL_ENV_DISABLE_PROMPT=$VIRTUAL_ENV_DISABLE_PROMPT export WORKING_DIR=$WORKING_DIR export ZUUL_CHANGES=$ZUUL_CHANGES export ZUUL_PIPELINE=$ZUUL_PIPELINE EOF } function loadvars { source ~/oooq_internal_vars.sh || echo "Can not load variables from ~/oooq_internal_vars.sh" }

commit_message:
[WIP] Replace QUICKSTART_RELEASE and UPGRADE_RELEASE

They are replaced by using the vars generated at releases.sh at
toci_quickstart.sh QUICKSTART_RELEASE is replaced by OVERCLOUD_DEPLOY_RELEASE.

Change-Id: I5fa32f21afe6f2b80847c1ca7b0d83012a340f3a

commit_message:
tox: make pytest verbose

Add -v flag to pytest tests. Without it, pytest shows only the files
being processed. When we add new unit test, we can now see explicitly
that the test ran and passed.

Change-Id: Ib9407b4401897797f7da892efe1bf200e869c7d8

commit_message:
Fix periodic undercloud install release file

If we want to add featureset050 (undercloud upgrade) to the periodic
jobs the undercloud_install_release have to be the release file
without the periodic suffix "promotion-testing-hash-"

Change-Id: I0a68d030a049fdba98a29b5ead9be17502557eb0

commit_message:
Fix stackviz data

In third party logs server, the stackviz data gzipped isn't being
gunzipped in real time, so, it doesn't render stackviz report properly,
saying there's no records.

Change-Id: I26d8d80f834c833811a2f2b76a8d8fe3e2f20e44

commit_message:
WIP: DNM: Enable upstream testing of tripleo-ha-utils

 - Add fs041 to run with full (single) playbook
 - Include local copies of external repos

commit_message:
Use constraints when when building images

Currently the way we install diskimage-builder doesn't use constraints,
but DIB relies on constraints to exclude known bad releases (in this case
networkx 2.X)

This change leverages the fact we have the requirements repo to get the
upper-constraints.txt, in a Depends-On friendly way, and then
manipulates that so that we can use it in these test jobs.

Change-Id: I88c23685e0f2f27278c23aa9e7256681639e5039
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/02/583102/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We want DIB and tripleo-common from source and therefore we need to remove them from the # constraints file. To do that we want the edit-constraints.txt tox -evenv -- pip install $WORKSPACE/requirements export UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=$WORKSPACE/requirements/upper-constraints.txt # First we need to remove them from upper-constraints.txt tox -evenv -- edit-constraints $UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE -- diskimage-builder tox -evenv -- edit-constraints $UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE -- tripleo-common tox -evenv -- pip install -c$UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE $WORKSPACE/diskimage-builder $WORKSPACE/tripleo-common # A little debugging help :) cp $UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE $WORKSPACE/logs

commit_message:
[WIP][DNM] Add ansible module to emit_releases_file.py

Change-Id: Iaceb4f785735043bba09d24cf1aecfbe6aa2a36c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/00/585200/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/python ANSIBLE_METADATA = { 'metadata_version': '1.1', 'status': ['preview'], 'supported_by': 'community' } DOCUMENTATION = ''' --- module: my_sample_module short_description: This is my sample module version_added: "2.4" description: - "This is my longer description explaining my sample module" options: name: description: - This is the message to send to the sample module required: true new: description: - Control to demo if the result of this module is changed or not required: false extends_documentation_fragment: - azure author: - Your Name (@yourhandle) ''' EXAMPLES = ''' # Pass in a message - name: Test with a message my_new_test_module: name: hello world # pass in a message and have changed true - name: Test with a message and changed output my_new_test_module: name: hello world new: true # fail the module - name: Test failure of the module my_new_test_module: name: fail me ''' RETURN = ''' original_message: description: The original name param that was passed in type: str message: description: The output message that the sample module generates ''' from ansible.module_utils.basic import AnsibleModule def run_module(): # define the available arguments/parameters that a user can pass to # the module module_args = dict( name=dict(type='str', required=True), new=dict(type='bool', required=False, default=False) ) # seed the result dict in the object # we primarily care about changed and state # change is if this module effectively modified the target # state will include any data that you want your module to pass back # for consumption, for example, in a subsequent task result = dict( changed=False, original_message='', message='' ) # the AnsibleModule object will be our abstraction working with Ansible # this includes instantiation, a couple of common attr would be the # args/params passed to the execution, as well as if the module # supports check mode module = AnsibleModule( argument_spec=module_args, supports_check_mode=True ) # if the user is working with this module in only check mode we do not # want to make any changes to the environment, just return the current # state with no modifications if module.check_mode: return result # manipulate or modify the state as needed (this is going to be the # part where your module will do what it needs to do) result['original_message'] = module.params['name'] result['message'] = 'goodbye' # use whatever logic you need to determine whether or not this module # made any modifications to your target if module.params['new']: result['changed'] = True # during the execution of the module, if there is an exception or a # conditional state that effectively causes a failure, run # AnsibleModule.fail_json() to pass in the message and the result if module.params['name'] == 'fail me': module.fail_json(msg='You requested this to fail', **result) # in the event of a successful module execution, you will want to # simple AnsibleModule.exit_json(), passing the key/value results module.exit_json(**result) def main(): run_module() if __name__ == '__main__': main()

commit_message:
Change release to -previous if the job is an update

When testing an updates, we need to use the release file that installs
the previous known good hash at first, then the process will update to
the latest hash.

Change-Id: I45c0e90843b44c7978ac6e2aae40349f67a38084
Depends-On: I9d56606fd034415d450a32cd04e537713e340ff9

subject: Stop collecting ephemeral temp dirs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-11 22:23:11.000000000', 'files': ['toci-quickstart/config/collect-logs.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/commit/f11fd1b45cbd838c581a55a4a01d515f06cdec52', 'message': "Stop collecting ephemeral temp dirs

Seeing a ton of things like:

  logs/apache/.~tmp~/keystone_wsgi_main_error.txt.gz

in the log dirs (13k for one job to be precise) Even though /tmp was
already removed, let's make sure we're not accidentally sucking these
over somehow.

Change-Id: I087e6440925de64e4bcd5120a64da306f7acc20a
"}]
commit_message:
Stop collecting ephemeral temp dirs

Seeing a ton of things like:

  logs/apache/.~tmp~/keystone_wsgi_main_error.txt.gz

in the log dirs (13k for one job to be precise) Even though /tmp was
already removed, let's make sure we're not accidentally sucking these
over somehow.

Change-Id: I087e6440925de64e4bcd5120a64da306f7acc20a

commit_message:
ovb: Remove bin/ and usr/ from working_dir tarball

This commit removes bin/ and usr/ from the quickstar.tar file to save
space. By analyzing the log contents, this accounts for 24MB out of the
log, which can be the largest portion. Since the data contained in here
shouldn't be that valuable, we should exclude it from collection.

Change-Id: Iaeb3c92f58f255805adbd9ee7487afd9293a192e

commit_message:
Fix backup tests

This patch add an additional possibility when checking instance status
after backup - backup may be done fast so we may get response 'ACTIVE'.

Change-Id: I93efba6aa11842ee2499550ab9293b65d75448e0
Story: #2005422
Task: #30444
Signed-off-by: Kasper Hasior <k.hasior@samsung.com>

commit_message:
[train][goal] Run 'trove-tempest-ipv6-only' job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will
deploy services on IPv6.

Depends on commit has added the new job 'trove-tempest-ipv6-only'
which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'trove-tempest-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Run the ipv6 job on trove gate also.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677014/

Story: #2005477
Task: #35937

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: I2ecfcef4a03ccc574d4fd3b026183342cb1fa242
