commit_message:
Add an OVN configuration file

This patch is adding a new ovn.yaml configuration file which can deploy
a containerized overcloud with OVN configured.

Change-Id: Iedc2cd429a00b4d95b127688517f186cb67e7f12
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/35/557735/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Summary of the feature set. # Deploy an Openstack environment with OVN configured in the containerized # overcloud deploy_timeout: 190 network_isolation: true enable_pacemaker: true overcloud_ipv6: false containerized_overcloud: true # This enables TLS for the undercloud which will also make haproxy bind # to the configured public-vip and admin-vip. undercloud_generate_service_certificate: true # This enables the deployment of the overcloud with SSL. ssl_overcloud: false # This featureset is extremely resource intensive, so we disable telemetry # in order to reduce the overall memory footprint This is not required # in newton telemetry_args: >- {% if release != 'newton' %} -e {{ overcloud_templates_path }}/environments/disable-telemetry.yaml {% endif %} # TODO(numans) - Change to neutron-ml2-ovn-ha.yaml once OVN bundle # pacemaker support is ready. extra_args: >- --ntp-server pool.ntp.org -e {{ overcloud_templates_path }}/environments/docker.yaml -e {{ overcloud_templates_path }}/environments/services-docker/neutron-ovn-ha.yaml prepare_service_env_args: >- -e {{ overcloud_templates_path }}/environments/docker.yaml -e {{ overcloud_templates_path }}/environments/docker-ha.yaml -e {{ overcloud_templates_path }}/environments/services-docker/neutron-ovn-ha.yaml # If `run_tempest` is `true`, run tempests tests, otherwise do not # run them. tempest_config: true test_ping: false run_tempest: false test_regex: '' tempest_whitelist: - 'tempest.scenario.test_network_basic_ops.TestNetworkBasicOps.test_network_basic_ops'

commit_message:
Create undercloud interfaces with multi-nic net-iso

In order to use multiple-nic network isolation, we need to
create an IP on the overcloud external network interface on
the undercloud. The simplest method for that is to use the
existing template and just specify the correct config.

Read in the network_isolation variables by adding
tq/roles/environment to the dependencies for this role.

See https://review.openstack.org/475363

Change-Id: Icd9353df12140e534337c2f5486e3d9ffef8a623

commit_message:
[Doc] Fix links to featureset files

Links to featureset files in doc/source/feature-configuration-generated.rst
were wrong and there was 404 page after going to those files from
"Feature Configuration" docs page.

This patch fixes those links that they will link to proper files
for each featureset.

Change-Id: I51e702874387ee6fb1b7b8ca68c5ea9f34c9ea1d

commit_message:
[train][goal] Define new 'trove-tempest-ipv6-only' job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will
deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'trove-tempest-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'trove-tempest-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35937

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: Ia247e3f22d1791c1b910f702781e7c5968c925db

commit_message:
Restore AllNodesExtraMapData

This commit is the same as I890bbef764b6bae7cb71cfedaff2ce17829737fb, which was
previously applied to tripleo-common, but lost in the migration to
tripleo-ansible.

Commit a7661065743086961b8ef93056b810e7d2a49eda removed the
all-nodes-config.j2.yaml Heat template. This template had the support
for specifying hieradata to merge into the all_nodes hieradata via the
AllNodesExtraMapData.

This commit restores the merge logic so that the merged hieradata from
the parameter value and the calculated hieradata is rendered in
all_nodes.json.

Change-Id: I49948f8d74c3846321af4f423a4891a71d0fabdc
Closes-Bug: #1839546

DNM: Test PDF building

The change to fetch-sphinx-tarball in zuul/jobs cannot be tested
since the playbook is protected.

Thus, add a new post playbook that runs fetch-sphinx-tarball again, it
will use the updated change from the dependency.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/678336
Change-Id: Ic28912a8701cfc71180e23974af1af8925fa15bc

Sphinx reports warning `html_static_path entry '_static' does not exist`
when running `tox -e docs`. This warning is treated as error in zuul
check. This fix just removes `_static` from

commit_message:
Fix tox docs failure

doc/source/_static directory is required by oslo.policy sample generator.
_static directory is empty in the cinder repo but it must exist.
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/571106/ dropped doc/source/_static/.placeholder
accidentally. This commit recovers the place holder file to ensure
doc/source/_static directory exists.

Closes-bug: #1841131
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ifad4371afa096afc2d0d71f6f077a53a9e52b60a

commit_message:
Explicitly set notification driver for novajoin

Novajoin is reliant on some notifications from nova. We recently merged
an update to the undercloud installation that disables the notification
drvier across the board if telemetry is disabled. This change adds a
service_config_setting for nova to force the notification driver to
messagingv2. This should be merged with the service configurations and
override the value that is normally set via NotificationDriver.

Change-Id: Ifee8f7f50fc2ef99605cbbcaa89016514b80b561
Closes-Bug: #1841100

service_setup: refactor service setup to a single file

service_setup.yml which will eventually be managed by
openstack-ansible-tests.

commit_message:
Unescape IPv6 addresses for ceph_nfs_bind_addr

Currently we end up with IPv6 addresses in ganesha.conf that
are encapsulated in brackets so the file isn't parsed correctly
and the ceph_nfs container fails to start.

Closes-bug: #1840983
Change-Id: I035f945df3ea0519ce8b62daa6d0b313e84a508c
(cherry picked from commit 0478cd8923f3ce23c700aa2efac7a8fe518ab2ea)
(cherry picked from commit a2cbb5044ed82f8e5c2628d2945c056e170819ae)

commit_message:
Adopt timers for new tenacity release

A new tenacity release [0] has been made which changes the behaviour
of the "wait_exponential" function [1], effectively halving the
multiplier. This leads to issues in the tests where the functionality
is being tested. To resolve the issue, just double the base multiplier.

This change can be used with the former and the new "wait_exponential"
code. If the older version of "tenacity" library is being used, the
waiting periods will be bigger but won't affect the behaviour. We can
avoid then enforcing the minimum version of this library. This is
desirable because this change was made in a minor release.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/677052
[1] https://github.com/jd/tenacity/commit/aac4307a0aa30d7befd0ebe4212ee4fc69083a95

Change-Id: Ib9055871623f642a74899de8eb536a05c5365f24

commit_message:
Make the build reproducible

Default values of method params are used in Sphinx.
MAX_SIMULTANEOUS_JOB which is default value of max_simultaneous_jobs
contains number of CPU. Change default value in method param to None
and set it in method body. This doesn't change behaviour, only generated
docs.

Change-Id: I950e4c8702138186bfa943730be9dd97b9f060ba
Origin: https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=860374

In multi-expirer environment (processes > 0) process number is used
to choose objects inside container to expirer. So every expirer iterate
__all__ containers and try to find own objects to expirer.
After this change shard is used to choose container name and thus
every expirer have own containers set.

Changes:
* use end_marker to iterate only containers/objects in past
* split container name to rounded timestamp and shard_id
* use shard_id to choose correct expirer server
* allow to choose shards count for expirer containter splitting

Change-Id: I885074784b1699e5e82a74750d32533e12599085
'}]
commit_message:
object-expirer optimization

In multi-expirer environment (processes > 0) process number is used
to choose objects inside container to expirer. So every expirer iterate
__all__ containers and try to find own objects to expirer.
After this change shard is used to choose container name and thus
every expirer have own containers set.

Changes:
* use end_marker to iterate only containers/objects in past
* split container name to rounded timestamp and shard_id
* use shard_id to choose correct expirer server
* allow to choose shards count for expirer containter splitting

Change-Id: I885074784b1699e5e82a74750d32533e12599085
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/23/391623/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Divisor for splitting expiring requests into multiple containers. This is number of seconds. The default is 86400. .IP \fBexpiring_objects_container_shards\fR How many containers are used for every "divisor" interval. For best performance, this number should be same or multiply of number of expirers (processes option in object-expirer.conf). The default is 100.Name of internal account used for expiring objects. The default is 'expiring_objects'.

commit_message:
object-replicator cleanup

Changes:
* Make direct_client not override User-Agent
* Use direct_client for getting remote hashes
* Added replication_port to error messages
* Have global timeout in direct_client for getting hashes
* If REPLICATE command after rsync fail, count it as failure
* More checks for error logs in replicator unit tests
* Allow to get all hashes in direct_client.direct_get_suffix_hashes

Partial-Bug: #1550565
Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hpe.com>
Change-Id: Icb723ee9eada8728f14eca919b982492c98a24bb

commit_message:
Show only directories not files in recon device list

If you put some files/sockets/symlinks in /srv/node directory,
swift-recon will show something like this:
[2015-12-15 18:35:02] Getting unmounted drives from 1 hosts...
Not mounted: MegaSAS.log on 127.0.0.1:6000

This patch will skip anything other than directories when listing
devices.

Change-Id: I1e144d0b6c921db22389f23b5787a3023e0e17a3

commit_message:
Remove ec2 token support

This change removes the ec2_token handler as part of the effort to
remove existing v2 functonality

Change-Id: Ife690e3daa2d04d9341847a84e29412d85eb1dca

commit_message:
Remove eventlet import from docs conf.py

It is not needed and create problems when trying to create the
documentation from an sdist tarball when git is installed (see [0] how
the problem will be solved in openstackdocstheme).

[0] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677868/
Change-Id: Iff0c9a4e99ecc16e495fb6283479839595037bc0

commit_message:
Ignore hacking rule H101

I can't think of any examples when this has proven to
be truly useful.  Many of the entries point to
contributors who are no longer active in the community.

This rule also encourages people writing TODOs to put
their own name, which may needlessly prevent others
from helping fix issues in the code.

Change-Id: I6b749fcc459474eb6ca4ad6331de9138dd702cd0

commit_message:
Add retries when loading keystone data and fetching endpoints

We may end up loading lots of nested stacks concurrently with
convergence and those would try to discover endpoints and fetch
access info objects from keystone. This at times results in
ConnectTimeout errors from keystone. We can avoid these errors
by adding some retries.

Also adds retries to client_plugin get_endpoint() calls, which has
simillar issue.

Change-Id: I18cde971248eff5783f97c9e7a60316d7dd93431
Task: 36349

commit_message:
Use connect_retries when creating clients

When creating session clients we should use 'connect_retries'
for clients that use Adapter interface. This will
allow retries when we get ConnectTimeout errors.

Task: 36331
Change-Id: Ic526c8039c91353e772eee7b55f1d263470c86bb

commit_message:
Sync wait-for-pods script with the one from openstack-helm

Change-Id: I709362ea9e6c1d0fe2c567556ebf7c3b666e9849
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/68/659568/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # From Kolla-Kubernetes, orginal authors Kevin Fox & Serguei Bezverkhi # Default wait timeout is 900 secondstimeout=${2:-900} end=$((end + timeout)) PENDING="True" || PENDING="False" kubectl get jobs --namespace=$1 -o json | jq -r \ if [ $now -gt $end ] ; then echo "Containers failed to start after $timeout seconds" echo kubectl get pods --namespace $1 -o wide echo if [ $PENDING == "True" ] ; then echo "Some pods are in pending state:" kubectl get pods --field-selector=status.phase=Pending -n $1 -o wide fi [ $READY == "False" ] && echo "Some pods are not ready" [ $JOBR == "False" ] && echo "Some jobs have not succeeded" exit -1 fi
deleted_lines: # From Kolla-Kubernetes, original authors Kevin Fox & Serguei Bezverkhi # Default wait timeout is 600 secondsif ! [ -z $2 ]; then end=$((end + $2)) else end=$((end + 900)) fi PENDING=True || PENDING=False kubectl get jobs -o json --namespace=$1 | jq -r \ [ $now -gt $end ] && echo containers failed to start. && \ kubectl get pods --namespace $1 -o wide && exit -1

commit_message:
ceph-base: Disable ceph-ansible firewall tasks

TripleO already manages firewall rules so we don't need to have both
enabled in the same time.
It's currently not an issue because the firewall rules aren't apply by
ceph-ansible on containerized deployment but it will be enabled soon.

Change-Id: I2b8fc3fcf757e5a24696f2d3575fe696b9cdfdf0
Co-Authored-By: Dimitri Savineau <dsavinea@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 954abc8e9b0920ef5cb7b0c997af3af0409d72b8)

DNM: Gate: network-policy job

This patch set attempts to fix the non-passing NV network policy jobs.

commit_message:
Remove deprecated options for keystone eventlet server

This patch removes keystone options related to deprecated eventlet server
implementation. We do not need them because currently we use httpd to
run keystone as its wsgi application.

Change-Id: I6fe4de67dbe38257070596c345dd214115aa45ee

added_lines: keystone::public_endpoint: {get_param: [EndpointMap, KeystonePublic, uri_no_suffix]} keystone::admin_endpoint: {get_param: [EndpointMap, KeystoneAdmin, uri_no_suffix]}
deleted_lines: keystone::admin_bind_host: str_replace: template: "%{hiera('fqdn_$NETWORK')}" params: $NETWORK: {get_param: [ServiceNetMap, KeystoneAdminApiNetwork]} keystone::public_bind_host: str_replace: template: "%{hiera('fqdn_$NETWORK')}" params: $NETWORK: {get_param: [ServiceNetMap, KeystonePublicApiNetwork]}

commit_message:
Sync deployed-server-roles-data.yaml with roles_data.yaml

Now that disable_constraints doesn't exist, these roles data files
should be identical. A followup should delete
deployed-server-roles-data.yaml when the documentation is updated to
not refer to it.

Change-Id: I42adaab0251a9ab4abdbb54fb7e28a8f89210424

commit_message:
Deprecate NeutronSriovNumVFs and neutron-sriov-host-config

Deprecating the parameter NeutronSriovNumVFs and the service
neutron-sriov-host-config. The numvfs shall be configured
using the sriov_pf type in nic configs.

Depends-On: I2923e046727c901219be693f248b7c0078331b83
Change-Id: I977a69add983cfe59f2dd82f05ebf7e11a85c25e

commit_message:
Make mistral optional for Ansible Update and Upgrade

Add option: --no-workflow to enable running ansible
update and upgrade outside of mistral.

Depends-On: I0c106cf795a6830a87790f1075889a6a4db65d22
Change-Id: I77f1a4efb5c60ffb5d7363d0343101fb6e702292
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/95/670295/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parser.add_argument('-e', '--extra-vars', dest='extra_vars', action='append', help=('Set additional variables as key=value or ' 'yaml/json'), default=[]) parser.add_argument('--no-workflow', dest='no_workflow', default=None, action="store", help=_('Run ansible-playbook directly via ' 'system command instead of running Ansible' 'via the TripleO mistral workflows.') ) orchestration = clients.orchestration ansible_dir = None key = None # Disable mistral if no_workflow: package_update = None ansible_dir = oooutils.download_ansible_playbooks(orchestration, stack) key = package_update.update_ansible(clients) verbosity=verbosity, extra_vars=extra_vars, wordir=ansible_dir, priv_key=key)
deleted_lines: parser.add_argument( '-e', '--extra-vars', dest='extra_vars', action='append', help='Set additional variables as key=value or yaml/json', default=[]) verbosity=verbosity, extra_vars=extra_vars)

commit_message:
Sync Sphinx requirement

1. Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.
2. Remove unncessary "=="

Change-Id: I1bf65e1c7575940a6b1a0164d90d5aaa6cfc4b8a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-magnumclient refs/changes/90/666390/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Move cephfs and cephfs_*_pool ceph-ansible parameters in -base

We have to move these into the -base service so they are dumped in
"all" ansible group vars and correctly consumed by nfs role
when not colocated with mds.

Closes-Bug: 1840651
Change-Id: I7aec1b80e0f598fc86720d669151958ca7b2e01d

commit_message:
Follow up to Option to send all portgroup data

Clarifies the code in add_ports_to_network() so that it is clear
that the ironic ports that are created in neutron are not necessarily
all pxe-enabled. Adds more comments to describe the behaviour if
non-pxe-enabled ports are created in neutron.

Fixes a typo in the corresponding release note.

This is a follow up to I8d0f4e28efb05af704839f3b92cb3dfd48d57940.

Change-Id: I94ff18bc137401ff4cd316755408c2099bb563cb
Story: 2005494
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/16/677516/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: If the config option 'neutron.add_all_ports' is set, neutron ports for non-pxe-enabled ports are also created -- these neutron ports will not have any assigned IP addresses. ports_to_create = [p for p in task.ports if p.pxe_enabled] else: ports_to_create = task.ports if not ports_to_create: pxe_enabled = 'PXE-enabled ' if not add_all_ports else '' "No available %(enabled)sports on node %(node)s.") % {'enabled': pxe_enabled, 'node': node.uuid}) for ironic_port in ports_to_create: if not ironic_port.pxe_enabled: if len(failures) == len(ports_to_create): "Failed to create neutron ports for node's %(node)s ports " "%(ports)s.") % {'node': node.uuid, 'ports': ports_to_create})
deleted_lines: pxe_enabled_ports = [p for p in task.ports if p.pxe_enabled] else: pxe_enabled_ports = task.ports if not pxe_enabled_ports: "No available PXE-enabled port on node %s.") % node.uuid) for ironic_port in pxe_enabled_ports: if add_all_ports and not ironic_port.pxe_enabled: if len(failures) == len(pxe_enabled_ports): "Failed to create neutron ports for any PXE enabled port " "on node %s.") % node.uuid)

commit_message:
Deprecate options related to eventlet server

The usage of eventlet server in keystone was already depreacted,
so we should deprecate parameters related to the feature.

Notes:
 - public_bind_host and public_port still remain as valid parameters,
   to wait until users migrate to public_endpoint, which should be
   used instead.
 - admin_endpoint does not affect keystone configuration, but it is
   not yet deprecated as it is still used when validate_service is True.

Change-Id: Ibc8023caf8ad4ee16ebc08a943bdcc9f188c73c1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/30/677930/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*admin_bind_host*] # (Optional) The IP address of the public network interface to listen on # Default to '0.0.0.0'. # # [*public_bind_host*] # (Optional) The IP address of the public network interface to listen on # Default to '0.0.0.0'. # # [*admin_port*] # (Optional) Port that can be used for admin tasks. # Defaults to '35357' # # [*public_port*] # (Optional) Port that keystone binds to. # Defaults to '5000' # # [*admin_workers*] # (Optional) The number of worker processes to serve the admin eventlet application. # This option is deprecated along with eventlet and will be removed in M. # This setting has no affect when using WSGI. # Defaults to $::undef # # [*public_workers*] # (Optional) The number of worker processes to serve the public eventlet application. # This option is deprecated along with eventlet and will be removed in M. # This setting has no affect when using WSGI. # Defaults to $::undef # $admin_bind_host = undef, $public_bind_host = undef, $admin_port = undef, $public_port = undef, $admin_workers = undef, $public_workers = undef, if $admin_workers { warning('keystone::admin_workers is deprecated, has no effect and will be removed in a later release') } if $public_workers { warning('keystone::public_workers is deprecated, has no effect and will be removed in a later release') } if ! $admin_endpoint { warning('keystone::admin_endppint is not set, but will be required in a later release') } if ! $public_endpoint { warning('keystone::admin_endppint is not set will be required in a later release') } if $admin_bind_host { warning('keystone::admin_bind_host is deprecated, and will be removed in a later release. Use keystone::admin_endpoint instead') } else { $admin_bind_host = '0.0.0.0' } if $admin_port { warning('keystone::admin_port is deprecated, and will be removed in a later release. Use keystone::admin_endpoint instead') } else { $admin_port = '35357' } if $public_bind_host { warning('keystone::public_bind_host is deprecated, and will be removed in a later release. Use keystone::public_endpoint instead') } else { $public_bind_host = '0.0.0.0' } if $public_port { warning('keystone::public_port is deprecated, and will be removed in a later release. Use keystone::public_endpoint instead') } else { $public_port = '5000' }

commit_message:
Use default value for NovaLiveMigrationWaitForVIFPlug

The support to set config paramter NovaLiveMigrationWaitForVIFPlug
was added in I0048d1f57eeb3418b52f225f87810ea1a7250a0f which
default to true but has a condition as well, because of which
live-migration fails with timeout.

This changes removes the condition and uses the default value.

Also change Ib9fe6e1bfea1d5f62b2f2b6fdb12d16878108c3f fixes
the issue in networking-ovn project.

Change-Id: Iba2b7a94c23ff3bcc311e92b63d6c05d9cb6d065

commit_message:
Adds tripleo-clients-install role

This role allows to easily install either all or some of the openstack
clients.

commit_message:
Switch to promote docs job

We now use a promote job for publishing that avoids building again the
documents after merge. use this here as well.

We can only use the promote jobs when the job run in gate, so use the
same file conditions. To make those easier to sync, get rid of the
special tripleo job and use openstack-tox-docs directly.

For further details about promote jobs, see
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-August/008610.html

Change-Id: I8432eab9fcec488dc757eabc350ea3e6a9c53102

commit_message:
Remove the success-url from openstack-tox-docs

A recent change[1] switched how the documents are archived for the
openstack-tox-docs jobs. They are now under /docs instead of /html [2].

This patch removes the success-url override for the openstack-tox-docs
jobs so that the zuul job links will point to /docs.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677009/
[2] https://opendev.org/opendev/base-jobs/src/branch/master/ \
    playbooks/docs/promote.yaml#L24

Change-Id: I8f637e022c78c9be63def5db0c9f1302eab6cbea

commit_message:
Pass target_raid_config field to ironic variable

In order to create/delete RAID configuration via the Ansible driver
we should be able to retrieve the JSON target_raid_config data from
the node.

Change-Id: Ie1bbefbc438a6c7f4592ea96ff84d2d5eb2d412d
Story: 2006417
Task: 36307

commit_message:
Remove experimental job on openSUSE 42.3

openSUSE 42.3 is dead, remove the experimental job so
that openSUSE 42.3 can be removed completely from CI.

Note that on master this job was replaced with a newer job, but I don't
want to add a test with newer OS here.

commit_message:
Remove experimental job on openSUSE 42.3

openSUSE 42.3 is dead, remove the experimental job so
that openSUSE 42.3 can be removed completely from CI.

Note that on master this job was replaced with a newer job, but I don't
want to add a test with newer OS here.

Change-Id: I57e5517e7b77a0160f9dce38b3266e78323d522a

commit_message:
Create tripleo-cellv2 role

This change introduce tripleo-cellv2 role and playbook
create-nova-cell-v2.yaml to simplify the post steps when creating
an additional cellv2 in tripleo. For reference, [1] is the doc
patch providing at the moment the manual steps.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/672744

Change-Id: I288a9217dce948d33d9b47938e7977294d255c7a

commit_message:
Missing 'forced' flag for recent shade autorelease

Shade 1.32.0 was recently force-released by the release management
team but we missed adding the 'forced' flag on that auto-release.

Change-Id: I4b957b28ae6f00ca95369f07f9a23b1dd3a1ecc6

it can be used in ansible upgrade tasks.

commit_message:
Move SnapshotsActionsTest to master skip list

These tests are failing randomly due insufficient free virtual
space (-12.0GB) to accommodate thin provisioned 1GB volume on
host hostgroup in Cinder. Increasing LVM space does not fix the
actual issue.

Investigation is in-progress. Adding it to skip list for master
promotion.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/674556/

Related-Bug: #1841071

Change-Id: I0e73bc0e4b1abb761c2f5f470297b2f16928021c

subject: Explicitly set notification driver for novajoin
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-23 14:03:52.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud/commit/97b77d1d13321833c82fded6b817105e2624ab78', 'message': 'Explicitly set notification driver for novajoin

Novajoin is reliant on some notifications from nova. We recently
merged an update to the undercloud installation that disables
the notification drvier across the board if telemetry is disabled. This
change adds logic for nova to force the notification driver to
messagingv2.

Change-Id: I75bb75092fa348dc1c2dc465446cb91d4882cf15
Closes-Bug: #1841100
(cherry picked from commit 5f1b6c6e5001ed917d474bed33ca88103031de94)
'}]
commit_message:
Explicitly set notification driver for novajoin

Novajoin is reliant on some notifications from nova. We recently
merged an update to the undercloud installation that disables
the notification drvier across the board if telemetry is disabled. This
change adds logic for nova to force the notification driver to
messagingv2.

Change-Id: I75bb75092fa348dc1c2dc465446cb91d4882cf15
Closes-Bug: #1841100
(cherry picked from commit 5f1b6c6e5001ed917d474bed33ca88103031de94)

commit_message:
Fix functional.base.TestCase.openstack() to optionally omit --os-auth-type

Change the functional test TestCase.openstack() method to add a
way to not include the --os-auth-type option in order to test the
default auth-type logic.

Change-Id: I0f1ca2f7517a41278afaad5aaf4e98accb16bea2
Signed-off-by: Dean Troyer <dtroyer@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/59/678059/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """Executes openstackclient command for the given action NOTE(dtroyer): There is a subtle distinction between pasing cloud=None and cloud='': for compatibility reasons passing cloud=None continues to include the option '--os-auth-type none' in the command while passing cloud='' omits the '--os-auth-type' option completely to let the default handlers be invoked. """ if cloud is None: elif cloud == '': # Execute command with no auth options at all return execute( 'openstack ' + cmd, fail_ok=fail_ok ) else: # Execure command with an explicit cloud specified return execute( 'openstack --os-cloud=' + cloud + ' ' + cmd, fail_ok=fail_ok )
deleted_lines: """Executes openstackclient command for the given action.""" if cloud is not None: return execute( 'openstack --os-cloud={cloud} '.format(cloud=cloud) + cmd, fail_ok=fail_ok ) else:

commit_message:
Adds log_filters parameter to nova::compute::libvirt

Defines a filter to select a different logging level
for a given category log outputs, as specified in
https://libvirt.org/logging.html. Default undef

Change-Id: Ic48afe856ae60654d6cebf627b12509881933c59
Related-Bug: #1840140
(cherry picked from commit 0b0bd400659e5e545173417816ec346249f4860e)
(cherry picked from commit 749e4fbb25d71fb04883bb70f61676cca71df6de)
(cherry picked from commit bb8ff6cdc41402e14eb79a3569185011fc60013f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/13/678213/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*log_filters*] # (optional) Defines a filter to select a different logging level # for a given category log outputs, as specified in # https://libvirt.org/logging.html # Defaults to undef # $log_filters = undef, if $log_filters { libvirtd_config { 'log_filters': value => "\"${log_filters}\""; } }

subject: Fix test_novnc to adequately validate websocket upgrade
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-02 17:34:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/c48de3e4b9bef8b3bf9cf458274ba98428537b89', 'message': 'Fix test_novnc to adequately validate websocket upgrade

Currently, test_novnc validates the websocket upgrade by verifying
that the websocket response reports a protocol switch and that the
response includes a server name specified in the configuration
field vnc_server_header. This explicit server name configuration
field introduces a security concern and convolutes the code base.

HTTP RFC7231 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231) section 6.2.2
says that when switching protocols, the response "MUST generate
an Upgrade header field that indicates which protocols will be
switched to".

This patchset uses this required Upgrade field to validate the
websocket upgrade instead of an environment-based configuration
field, making the code base cleaner, safer, and more reliable.

Change-Id: I5d3c9bdd0d20a15ade672f276dd0f24b654e3de5
Closes-bug: #1838777
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-08-02 18:24:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/f980754ed0f01071cebbd463fc6d71b0f684b3d0', 'message': 'Fix test_novnc to adequately validate websocket upgrade

Currently, test_novnc validates the websocket upgrade by verifying
that the websocket response reports a protocol switch and that the
response includes a server name specified in the configuration
field vnc_server_header. This explicit server name configuration
field introduces a security concern and convolutes the code base.

HTTP RFC7231 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231) section 6.2.2
says that when switching protocols, the response "MUST generate
an Upgrade header field that indicates which protocols will be
switched to".

This patchset uses this required Upgrade field to validate the
websocket upgrade instead of an environment-based configuration
field, making the code base cleaner, safer, and more reliable.

vnc_server_header is deprecated and necessary release notes are
created.

commit_message:
Fix test_novnc to adequately validate websocket upgrade

Currently, test_novnc validates the websocket upgrade by verifying
that the websocket response reports a protocol switch and that the
response includes a server name specified in the configuration
field vnc_server_header. This explicit server name configuration
field introduces a security concern and convolutes the code base.

HTTP RFC7231 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231) section 6.2.2
says that when switching protocols, the response "MUST generate
an Upgrade header field that indicates which protocols will be
switched to".

This patchset uses this required Upgrade field to validate the
websocket upgrade instead of an environment-based configuration
field, making the code base cleaner, safer, and more reliable.

vnc_server_header is deprecated and necessary release notes are
created.

Change-Id: I5d3c9bdd0d20a15ade672f276dd0f24b654e3de5
Closes-bug: #1838777
Closes-bug: #1840788
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/64/674364/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: cfg.StrOpt('vnc_server_header', default='WebSockify', help='Expected VNC server name (WebSockify, nginx, etc) ' 'in response header.'),

commit_message:
py3: Switch swift-dsvm-functional-py3 to run tests under py3

Now that all of the func tests are ported, we may as well run all-py3.

Change-Id: Ib9f75ca9efb46dc4c7730ad2718228ec7777c924

commit_message:
Use fluentd image labels

In order to orchestrate smooth transition to fluentd 0.14.x
aka 1.0 stable branch aka td-agent 3
from td-agent repository - use image labels (fluentd_version
and fluentd_binary).

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/676411
Change-Id: Iab8518c34ef876056c6abcdb5f2e9fc9f1f7dbdd

added_lines: - name: Fetch image labels vars: service_name: "fluentd" service: "{{ common_services[service_name] }}" docker_image_facts: name: "{{ service.image }}" register: fluentd_labels - src: "{{ '01-rewrite-0.14' if fluentd_labels.images.0.ContainerConfig.Labels.fluentd_version == '0.14' else '01-rewrite-0.12' }}"

commit_message:
use promote job

Change doc publishing to a promote job so that we do not need to rebuild
docs in the post pipeline.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-August/008610.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/677799
Change-Id: Ie9905d27532375d58500a828c6364117b54b1557

commit_message:
Capture console logs from failed server create

In the cinder resource creation we have been timing out ssh connection
tests to the test server. Unfortunately all of the existing logs I can
find indicate that this server is fine. Lets dump the console log to see
if that gives us any more info when ssh connectivity times out.

Change-Id: Ife397941deab80658fff375846a690a46a0c8b02

commit_message:
3PAR adds reporting of multiattach support

The 3PAR driver has long supported the ability to do
multiattach of volumes.   This patch updates the
capability reporting to support multiattach.

Change-Id: Ied9f31c7fcab18f09971fd8b732c4fdbdc7b7fde
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/67/560067/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 4.0.9 - Added reporting of multiattach support. VERSION = "4.0.9" 'multiattach': True,

subject: Stop treating .gz files as special in log handling
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-19 17:53:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/b1081976dd7a55b4a14b07e17a1bd72e2303b6fb', 'message': 'Stop treating .gz files as special in log handling

With our switch to swift hosted logs files ended in .gz are no longer
equivalent to the filenames without the .gz. Swift expects us to be
speific. For this reason normalize on using the actual file names as
stored and reported rather than removing the suffix for human
friendliness.

Change-Id: I88ec2eea371fd82ebfc84a8b403cf6f192e25a5e
Related-Change: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677236
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-08-19 20:07:00.000000000', 'files': ['roles/submit-log-processor-jobs/library/submit_log_processor_jobs.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/71c1b4fd660db65ebd44f6706f17f41d2e147b9f', 'message': 'Stop treating .gz files as special in log handling

With our switch to swift hosted logs files ended in .gz are no longer
equivalent to the filenames without the .gz. Swift expects us to be
speific. For this reason normalize on using the actual file names as
stored and reported rather than removing the suffix for human
friendliness.

Note we keep the .gz less tag value in the tags list. This is because
e-r typically uses tags to identify files rather than pure paths or
filenames.

Change-Id: I88ec2eea371fd82ebfc84a8b403cf6f192e25a5e
Related-Change: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677236
'}]
commit_message:
Stop treating .gz files as special in log handling

With our switch to swift hosted logs files ended in .gz are no longer
equivalent to the filenames without the .gz. Swift expects us to be
speific. For this reason normalize on using the actual file names as
stored and reported rather than removing the suffix for human
friendliness.

Note we keep the .gz less tag value in the tags list. This is because
e-r typically uses tags to identify files rather than pure paths or
filenames.

Change-Id: I88ec2eea371fd82ebfc84a8b403cf6f192e25a5e
Related-Change: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677236
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/65/677265/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Note that even if we upload a .gz we want to use the logical # non compressed name for handling (it is easier on humans). # The reason we can get away with this is that this name is used # to construct the log_url below. The server serving that # log_url treats foo.txt and foo.txt.gz as being the same content # and serves both paths from the same backend content. if name.endswith('.gz'): self._name = name[:-3] else: self._name = name

'pdf' tox target or similar. Get the former and avoid the latter by
adding a step to build our PDFs to the 'openstack-tox-docs' job.

The job assumes 'pdfdocs' tox env to build PDF docs.
If 'pdfdocs' tox env does not exist, PDF doc build will be skipped.
The generated PDF file will be fetched to the log directory if exists.

Note that only the job for master and stein is updated,
we do not build PDFs for older releases.

Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Andreas Jaeger <aj@suse.com>

commit_message:
Add support for building PDFs

We want PDFs. We don't want to have to go to each project and add a
'pdf' tox target or similar. Get the former and avoid the latter by
adding a step to build our PDFs to the 'openstack-tox-docs' job.

The job assumes a 'pdf-docs' tox env to build PDF docs.
If 'pdf-docs' tox env does not exist, PDF doc build will be skipped.

Note that only the job for master and stein is updated,
we do not build PDFs for older releases.

Do not build PDFs for deploy-guide for now.

Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Andreas Jaeger <aj@suse.com>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/678077
Change-Id: Ibc455ba511a877159848f4060a6058800d7d2f9b

commit_message:
CI: Fix periodic jobs for Ironic and Zun

These jobs were smart to define files at the base level
but this makes periodic never pick them up because
there are no changes in periodic.

This patch overrides files in periodic pipeline so that
the jobs can run.

Change-Id: I9e4ae713ad0c5e7ef1e60cc9f00fe4ed117e3e6c
Signed-off-by: Radosaw Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/70/678170/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(yoctozepto): files overrides are required for jobs defining them # so that periodic can run them (in periodic there are no changes) - kolla-ansible-centos-source-zun: { files: .* } - kolla-ansible-ubuntu-source-zun: { files: .* } - kolla-ansible-centos-source-ironic: { files: .* } - kolla-ansible-centos-binary-ironic: { files: .* } - kolla-ansible-ubuntu-source-ironic: { files: .* }

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-22 08:27:06.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/kolla-openstack/templates/inspector.ipxe.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/commit/3c5fc217b01ebb095046102a2d497ff979b2db5f', 'message': 'Fix inspector iPXE boot with UEFI compute nodes

Rocky only

The IPA ramdisk fails to boot on UEFI compute nodes with iPXE. We see

block(0,0)

The cause is the lack of an initrd=ironic-agent.initramfs kernel
argument in inspector.ipxe.

Rather than removing the kayobe override template as was done in stein,
for Rocky we take the less risky approach of adding the kernel argument
to our template.

Change-Id: I5363cb18b361d450ef8e77c553cc21ee2241ba79
Story: 2006214
Task: 35804
'}]
commit_message:
Fix inspector iPXE boot with UEFI compute nodes

Rocky only

The IPA ramdisk fails to boot on UEFI compute nodes with iPXE. We see
the following error on the console, followed by a kernel panic:

Fix kernel panic-not syncing: VFS: unable to mount root fs on unknown
block(0,0)

The cause is the lack of an initrd=ironic-agent.initramfs kernel
argument in inspector.ipxe.

Rather than removing the kayobe override template as was done in stein,
for Rocky we take the less risky approach of adding the kernel argument
to our template.

Change-Id: I5363cb18b361d450ef8e77c553cc21ee2241ba79
Story: 2006214
Task: 35804

commit_message:
Emit an error for a missing E-mail template

Instead of silently doing nothing when asked to render a message for
an event with no available template, return nonzero and provide an
explanation.

Change-Id: I8b86ad1d90f8e83f0d37cade73a94be041b07ae7

commit_message:
Fix configuration for TC Elections event

For reasons not worth delving into this close to putting it to use,
we've used "PTL Election" (singular) and "TC Elections" (plural) as
the expected event names in our election tooling. Correct the errant
"TC Election" entry in the present election config.

Change-Id: Ifc588fc7a47738ab8262d5754adc38f7f7ec50d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/69/678069/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
libvirt: Start reporting PCPU inventory to placement

This requires a lot of hand holding for legacy configuration options
(hence the plethora of tests) but this is all required to not break
upgrades.

A new '[compute] cpu_dedicated_set' config option is added, including a
wall of text necessary to explain the upgrade implications of this
option. The 'vcpu_pin_set' option is also deprecated, while the help
text for the 'reserved_host_cpus' option is updated to specify that it
will be ignored for the libvirt driver.

The 'os-resource-classes' minimum version must be bumped to 0.2.0, as
that's the first version to include the 'PCPU' standard resource class.

Part of blueprint cpu-resources

Change-Id: I94d9a548ebf1efaf5400a0829ca07fa69047f32a
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

added_lines: deprecated_for_removal=True, deprecated_since='20.0.0', deprecated_reason=""" This option has been superseded by the ``[compute] cpu_dedicated_set`` and ``[compute] cpu_shared_set`` options, which allow things like the co-existence of pinned and unpinned instances on the same host. """,Defines which host CPUs can be used by instance CPUs. The behavior of this option depends on the definition of the ``[compute] cpu_dedicated_set`` and ``[compute] cpu_shared_set`` options. * If both ``[compute] cpu_dedicated_set`` is defined, this option will always be ignored. * If ``[compute] cpu_dedicated_set`` is not defined, this option will be used to determine where to allocate both ``VCPU`` and ``PCPU`` resources from. This will result in a host CPU being reported twice, a both a ``VCPU`` resource and a ``PCPU`` resource, and will require host aggregates to ensures all instances on a given host request a single type of CPU resource.Defines which host CPUs will be used for allocating ``VCPU`` resources and to host emulator threads when using the ``share`` emulator thread policy (``hw:emulator_threads_policy=share``). The behavior of this option depends on the definition of the ``[compute] cpu_dedicated_set`` and the deprecated ``vcpu_pin_set`` options. * If both ``[compute] cpu_shared_set`` and ``[compute] cpu_dedicated_set`` are defined, these values will be respected and ``vcpu_pin_set`` will be ignored. * If ``[compute] cpu_shared_set`` is defined but ``[compute] cpu_dedicated_set`` is not, ``[compute] cpu_shared_set`` will only be used to place guest emulator threads and ``vcpu_pin_set`` will be used instead to determine where to allocate both ``VCPU`` and ``PCPU`` resources from. This will result in a host CPU being reported twice, a both a ``VCPU`` resource and a ``PCPU`` resource, and will require host aggregates to ensures all instances on a given host request a single type of CPU resource. * If ``[compute] cpu_dedicated_set`` is defined but ``[compute] cpu_shared_set`` is not, the host will only report ``PCPU`` resources and ``vcpu_pin_set`` will be ignored. This behavior will be simplified in a future release when ``vcpu_pin_set`` is removed. Possible values: * A comma-separated list of physical CPU numbers that instance VCPUs can be allocated to by default. Each element should be either a single CPU number, a range of CPU numbers, or a caret followed by a CPU number to be excluded from a previous range. For example:: Related options: * ``[compute] cpu_dedicated_set``: This is the counterpart option for defining where ``PCPU`` resources should be allocated from. * ``vcpu_pin_set``: A legacy option whose definition may change the behavior of this option. """), cfg.StrOpt('cpu_dedicated_set', help=""" Defines which host CPUs will be used for allocating ``PCPU`` resources. The behavior of this option depends on the definition of the ``[compute] cpu_shared_set`` and the deprecated ``vcpu_pin_set`` options. * If both ``[compute] cpu_shared_set`` and ``[compute] cpu_dedicated_set`` are defined, the host will report both ``VCPU`` and ``PCPU`` resources. * If ``[compute] cpu_dedicated_set`` is defined but ``[compute] cpu_shared_set`` is not, the host will only report ``PCPU`` resources and ``vcpu_pin_set`` will be ignored. * If ``[compute] cpu_shared_set`` is defined but ``[compute] cpu_dedicated_set`` is not, ``[compute] cpu_shared_set`` will only be used to place guest emulator threads and ``vcpu_pin_set`` will be used instead to determine where to allocate both ``VCPU`` and ``PCPU`` resources from. This will result in a host CPU being reported twice, a both a ``VCPU`` resource and a ``PCPU`` resource, and will require host aggregates to ensures all instances on a given host request a single type of CPU resource. This behavior will be simplified in a future release when ``vcpu_pin_set`` is removed. Possible values: * A comma-separated list of physical CPU numbers that instance VCPUs can be allocated to by default. Each element should be either a single CPU number, a range of CPU numbers, or a caret followed by a CPU number to be excluded from a previous range. For example:: cpu_dedicated_set = "4-12,^8,15" Related options: * ``[compute] cpu_dedicated_set``: This is the counterpart option for defining where ``PCPU`` resources should be allocated from. * ``vcpu_pin_set``: A legacy option which will be ignored if this option is defined.

commit_message:
Add ability to install kernel related packages

Added support to have the kernel class install packages prior to the
kmod loading.

Change-Id: I6085bcd2f91f84577dcf59d3c93afb24ab718a49
Related-Bug: #1840180
(cherry picked from commit cf8dc4658a4dbbffc145c24898be280ca47d902e)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-13 13:46:29.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/backup/drivers/ceph.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/e78b220f448c7eb0de35aafd1d49b00547384d41', 'message': "Fix ceph: only close rbd image after snapshot iteration is finished

list_snaps() returns an iterator object that requires resources from the
Image object. Closing the Image object deallocates these resources.

On Ceph mimic, which contains changes to the functions being invoked,
iterating over the snapshots of a closed image results in the following
assertion being triggered:

cinder-backup[29383]: /build/ceph-13.2.2/src/common/Mutex.cc: In function 'void Mutex::Lock(bool)' thread 7f35a4812700 time 2018-12-14 10:10:49.843120
cinder-backup[29383]: /build/ceph-13.2.2/src/common/Mutex.cc: 110: FAILED assert(r == 0)
cinder-backup[29383]:  ceph version 13.2.2 (02899bfda814146b021136e9d8e80eba494e1126) mimic (stable)
cinder-backup[29383]:  1: (ceph::__ceph_assert_fail(char const*, char const*, int, char const*)+0x102) [0x7f35903440f2]
cinder-backup[29383]:  2: (()+0x3162b7) [0x7f35903442b7]
cinder-backup[29383]:  3: (Mutex::Lock(bool)+0x1de) [0x7f359031901e]
cinder-backup[29383]:  4: (()+0x8f452) [0x7f358dafc452]

commit_message:
Fix ceph: only close rbd image after snapshot iteration is finished

list_snaps() returns an iterator object that requires resources from the
Image object. Closing the Image object deallocates these resources.

On Ceph mimic, which contains changes to the functions being invoked,
iterating over the snapshots of a closed image results in the following
assertion being triggered:

cinder-backup[29383]: /build/ceph-13.2.2/src/common/Mutex.cc: In function 'void Mutex::Lock(bool)' thread 7f35a4812700 time 2018-12-14 10:10:49.843120
cinder-backup[29383]: /build/ceph-13.2.2/src/common/Mutex.cc: 110: FAILED assert(r == 0)
cinder-backup[29383]:  ceph version 13.2.2 (02899bfda814146b021136e9d8e80eba494e1126) mimic (stable)
cinder-backup[29383]:  1: (ceph::__ceph_assert_fail(char const*, char const*, int, char const*)+0x102) [0x7f35903440f2]
cinder-backup[29383]:  2: (()+0x3162b7) [0x7f35903442b7]
cinder-backup[29383]:  3: (Mutex::Lock(bool)+0x1de) [0x7f359031901e]
cinder-backup[29383]:  4: (()+0x8f452) [0x7f358dafc452]
cinder-backup[29383]:  5: (()+0x11280d) [0x7f358db7f80d]
cinder-backup[29383]:  6: (rbd_snap_get_namespace_type()+0x29) [0x7f358dacf549]

The lock being tried to acquire and the object that contained it have
already been destroyed by closing the image. The assertion terminates
the cinder-backup service via SIGABRT.

On Ceph luminous we've seen occasional segfaults of the cinder-backup
service, which might have the same underlying cause.

Closes-Bug: #1838691

Change-Id: If6043d82cc57d9247a290816d90b95cdf719eaac
Signed-off-by: Sven Wegener <sven.wegener@inovex.de>
(cherry picked from commit 76569672599eda764f946ad6ee2ce0bdaddad36b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/95/676195/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if snaps is None: return False for snap in snaps: if snap['name'] == snap_name: return True

commit_message:
Allow to configure additional ipmitool retriable errors

This change allows to configure more retriable errors for ipmitool
execution that are specific to the environment it is run in.

Task: 36296
Story: 2006410
Change-Id: I4bd06ad405f87f5fb974777fc3d84e4874b4f5bb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/63/676963/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- other: - | This release allows to configure retryable ipmitool exceptions via ``[ipmi]additional_retryable_ipmi_errors`` so that, depending on the environment, operators could allow retrying ipmitool commands containing specified substrings.

commit_message:
python-ldap fix

In rocky and beyond pyldap becomes python-ldap. The structure of the
previous patch to fix them means we must always update the pydep.txt
list with a new release of openstack.

Reordering this we can explictly install only when the version is older
than rocky. Added openstack releases back to the Newton release for
compatibility.

Change-Id: Ibf88bd2113029d750f9a4f32e288e3d8be3a1bfd

commit_message:
Add hosts option to admin authorize command.

During overcloud upgrade we need to be able to specify which hosts
should get the ssh keys during re-provisioning.

Sanitizing host input in enable_ssh_admin: skip empty ip and ignore
extra spaces.

Change-Id: I5868b1f9dcd08bd8135dca3e5d4e3a46d4ebb8cd
Implements: blueprint upgrades-with-os

commit_message:
Remove all unused upgrade tasks.

As we are upgrading by provisioning, we don't need to adjust the
previous version to the new version of tripleo/os as we are starting
from a fresh image and a fresh deployment.

Change-Id: I538f00e86ffcd5813ef4b519b5fc5dd6f3cdbb47
Implements: blueprint upgrades-with-os

commit_message:
Display room capabilities

It is sometimes useful to mark certain rooms as having specific
capabilities like videoprojection. This change adds the possibility
to assign a glyphicon (cap_icon) and a mouseover description
(cap_desc) for the rooms in the schedule dictionary.

Change-Id: I343c28acc3ad6015d3382d526511f153bf38a0e6

commit_message:
Replace ceph_grafana-server with ceph_grafana

This change reflect the tht commit that replace
the ceph_grafana resource service name.
This is required here to retrieve properly the
hieradata resources.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/674556
Change-Id: I3eea8d1aa8aa56298add4d17ecad25610698f75e

commit_message:
Add the certificate specs in ceph_grafana composable service

In order to meet the tls cert request requirements, this
change adds the tht config and metadata settings.

Change-Id: Id62150e6e8fddb320ffb8ef94d33b03ed16c9ee6

commit_message:
Choose first node as bootstrap node name/ip

Previously when Heat was choosing the bootstrap node, it always chose
the first node due to the ResourceGroup ordering.

When it was switched to ansible, the last node was chosen instead due to
unpredictable dict sorting from the inventory.

This patch restores the previous behavior and makes sure the first node
in a group is always chosen as the bootstrap node for the both the name
and ip.

Change-Id: I716bf405d8a020770c178d82cd5e73d76a5c97f1

commit_message:
Restore AllNodesExtraMapData

Commit a7661065743086961b8ef93056b810e7d2a49eda removed the
all-nodes-config.j2.yaml Heat template. This template had the support
for specifying hieradata to merge into the all_nodes hieradata via the
AllNodesExtraMapData.

This commit restores the merge logic so that the merged hieradata from
the parameter value and the calculated hieradata is rendered in
all_nodes.json.

Change-Id: I890bbef764b6bae7cb71cfedaff2ce17829737fb
Depends-On: Ib3838d404b45ae6684ef7e0aa211cb8015271866

subject: Handle when upgrade_prepare_extra_params is a string.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-13 10:14:58.000000000', 'files': ['templates/overcloud_upgrade_prepare.sh.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/commit/95b84055850c20703f6e8c18e553b78a42ef0b27', 'message': "Handle when upgrade_prepare_extra_params is a string.

If for some reason, the upgrade_prepare_extra_params
parameter is passed as a string instead of a list, then
the string will be appended in the overcloud_upgrade_prepare.sh script in
the way 'character' -> -e c -e h -e a -e r -e c -e t -e r .
For that reason we need to add the logic to handle the string
as a list to properly work.

Change-Id: I8c1e671cadd0413a06a67766b0461bdbdeac3d32
(cherry picked from commit d67df9fae060ddfe9d936bdbbad0049c295b836c)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle when upgrade_prepare_extra_params is a string.

If for some reason, the upgrade_prepare_extra_params
parameter is passed as a string instead of a list, then
the string will be appended in the overcloud_upgrade_prepare.sh script in
the way 'character' -> -e c -e h -e a -e r -e c -e t -e r .
For that reason we need to add the logic to handle the string
as a list to properly work.

Change-Id: I8c1e671cadd0413a06a67766b0461bdbdeac3d32
(cherry picked from commit d67df9fae060ddfe9d936bdbbad0049c295b836c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade refs/changes/49/676149/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix python 3.6 escape char warnings in strings

3.6 is more strict about escape sequences in strings, causing
DeprecationWarnings for regex strings. This switches a few to raw
strings that were missed in I0e2bff9cb45974b159aed6a63913a63b1956aa32.

Change-Id: I7b2259a241ba2d4b9c7cbaec237c781d50bf2a6c
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-23 13:57:18.000000000', 'files': ['nova/console/websocketproxy.py', 'nova/tests/unit/console/test_websocketproxy.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e10bd65ab5986e5574b8145fc8ec7d9ab8b65439', 'message': 'Do not log token in the novncproxy logs

from the log which printed when the token is invalid. But another log

Related-Bug: #1197459

commit_message:
Do not log token in the novncproxy logs

Token is sensitive information so it should not be logged. Patch
If1b6e5f20d2ea82d94f5f0550f13189fc9bc16c4 already hide the token
from the log which printed when the token is invalid. But another log
dumps the whole connection info dict with the token. This patch sanitize
that the connection info dict before it is logged.

Change-Id: I9c2d15906b91ac74c9cfce8061184e91459846a8
Related-Bug: #1197459
Closes-Bug: #1841185
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/34/678234/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Explicitly set notification driver for novajoin

Novajoin is reliant on some notifications from nova. We recently
merged an update to the undercloud installation that disables
the notification drvier across the board if telemetry is disabled. This
change adds logic for nova to force the notification driver to
messagingv2.

Change-Id: I75bb75092fa348dc1c2dc465446cb91d4882cf15
Closes-Bug: #1841100

commit_message:
Spec: Add a v2 API endpoint to push DataFrame objects

See specs/train/add_push_dataframes_api_endpoint.rst for details.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/668669/
Change-Id: Ieb48eb72fcb6165d32c08b95ea61be5ffc7d0e92
Story: 2005890
Task: 35954
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty-specs refs/changes/94/672294/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =============================================== Add a v2 API endpoint to push DataFrame objects =============================================== https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2005890 CloudKitty needs an endpoint in its v2 API to push DataFrame objects. This spec aims at defining what is to be done and why. Everything in this document is open to discussion, equally on the associated storyboard and gerrit. Problem Description =================== With the current state of CloudKitty, there is no standard way to push DataFrames into the CloudKitty storage and certainly not through its API. This inconvenience prevents CloudKitty from being easily provisionned with DataFrame fixtures so it can be functionally tested with OpenStack Tempest. A new admin API endpoint is needed to allow this. These tests would enable a more efficient workflow to validate forthcoming features and therefore improve the overall quality and stability of them in a long term goal. Proposed Change =============== A new endpoint will be made available to admin users on ``POST /v2/dataframe``. This will allow end users to push DataFrames in the form of JSON objects. Alternatives ------------ What other ways could we do this thing? Why aren't we using those? This doesn't have to be a full literature review, but it should demonstrate that thought has been put into why the proposed solution is an appropriate one. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- This will add and endpoint on ``/v2/dataframe`` with support for the ``POST`` HTTP method. The endpoint will support as a body input a json array of one or several DataFrame json objects. A collection of DataFrame json objects can be described as follows : .. code-block:: javascript [ { # first DataFrame "period": { "begin": "20190723T122810Z", # valid ISO 8601 datetime format "end": "20190723T132810Z" # valid ISO 8601 datetime format }, "usage": { "metric_one": [ # list of DataPoint json objects { "vol": { "unit": "GiB", "qty": 1.2 }, "rating": { "price": 0.04 }, "groupby": { "group_one": "one", "group_two": "two" }, "metadata": { "attr_one": "one", "attr_two": "two" } } # { second DataPoint for metric_one here } ], "metric_two": [] } }, # { second DataFrame here } ] The expected HTTP success response code for a ``POST`` on this endpoint is ``201 Created``. Expected HTTP error response code for a ``POST`` request on this endpoint are: * ``400 Bad Request``: Malformed request. * ``403 Forbidden``: The user is not authorized to push DataFrame objects. This endpoint will only be authorized to administrator end users. Security impact --------------- Any user with access to this endpoint will be able to alterate data on the target platform which is an action carrying heavy side effects. Thus, access to this endpoint should be granted to non admin users with uttermost concern or not at all if possible. Notifications Impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- The client will also be updated to include a function and a CLI command allowing to push DataFrame objects. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- Importing DataFrame objects of any nature to CloudKitty will now be an easy process. This will be handy to provision CloudKitty if felt necessary. Developer impact ---------------- Importing DataFrame objects will allow pushing fixtures into CloudKitty storage. This will be handy to write integration tests thereafter. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <jferrieu> Other contributors: <peschk_l> Work Items ---------- * Implement the API endpoint with unit tests. * Add tempest tests. * Support this endpoint in the client. Dependencies ============ This endpoint depends on the DataFrame and DataPoint objects specification: * Spec (still in review): https://review.opendev.org/#/c/668669/ Testing ======= Unit tests and Tempest tests for this endpoint will be added. Documentation Impact ==================== The endpoint will be added to the API reference. References ========== Spec: Add a v2 API endpoint to push dataframe objects (still in review): https://review.opendev.org/#/c/668669/

commit_message:
Limit get_sdk_adapter to requested service type

Previously openstacksdk would process the config for *every* known
service type, even though get_sdk_adapter only cares about one at a
time. Aside from just being wasteful, this also resulted in weird log
messages complaining about other conf sections that weren't set up
properly for sdk consumption (which we don't care about). And that would
happen every time we requested an sdk adapter.

openstacksdk added support for restricting a Connection to a single
service type via [1]. So this commit takes advantage of it.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/674675

Change-Id: Ib0e43f6c9e28ce4f1ac1831a3e3558c825a372ca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/78/674678/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: confgrp = _get_conf_group(service_type) _, sess = _get_auth_and_session(confgrp) conn = connection.Connection(session=sess, oslo_conf=CONF) return getattr(conn, service_type)

commit_message:
Disable chrony container by default

Fixes an issue where multiple NTP daemons could be running on the
overcloud hosts, due to Kolla Ansible deploying a chrony container by
default starting with the Rocky release.

Kayobe now overrides this default, to ensure that chrony does not conflict
with the NTP daemon deployed on the host. To use the containerised chrony
daemon instead, set ``kolla_enable_chrony`` to ``true`` in
``${KAYOBE_CONFIG_PATH}/kolla.yml``. This will also disable the host NTP
daemon.

To ensure that chrony is not running, Kayobe removes the chrony container
if ``kolla_enable_chrony`` is ``false`` in the following commands:

* ``kayobe overcloud service deploy``
* ``kayobe overcloud service reconfigure``
* ``kayobe overcloud service upgrade``

The play in Kayobe is tagged with ``stop-chrony``.

Change-Id: I89a973c0b600abece79bddcba5a46cc28a4f1df9
Story: 2005272
Task: 30122
(cherry picked from commit 650919f52736b297de50bc48bb7fc71e19cb64a9)

commit_message:
Build fluentd containers for RHEL8

Initially fluentd containers were not built in RHEL8.
Removing it from exclude list will built the containers.

Related-Bug: #1841096

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add / Remove packages to support fluentd

Kolla is adding the td-agent package to their fluentd container. This
package is provided by a third-party and not something we want to
support at this time.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677063
Change-Id: I3a5a5ed0defe8ce0259e5c09eaec11814fd51054
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Refactor OSD bootstrap code out of charms.ceph

As the OSD bootstrap code is unique to ceph-osd, the code
to check / setup the OSD bootstrap & upgrade keys can be
moved in-tree.

Change-Id: Ia1639c81238ca782b5600bbe445cf6ee105bfd37
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-osd refs/changes/93/677693/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: write_file,_client_admin_keyring = '/etc/ceph/ceph.client.admin.keyring'def is_osd_bootstrapped():def is_bootstrapped(): return os.path.exists(_client_admin_keyring) def use_bluestore(): """Determine whether bluestore should be used for OSD's :returns: whether bluestore disk format should be used :rtype: bool""" if cmp_pkgrevno('ceph', '12.2.0') < 0: return False return config('bluestore') def bootstrap_monitor_cluster(secret): """Bootstrap local ceph mon into the ceph cluster :param secret: cephx secret to use for monitor authentication :type secret: str :raises: Exception if ceph mon cannot be bootstrapped """ _create_monitor(keyring, secret, hostname, path, done, init_marker) _create_keyrings()def _create_monitor(keyring, secret, hostname, path, done, init_marker): """Create monitor filesystem and enable and start ceph-mon process :param keyring: path to temporary keyring on disk :type keyring: str :param secret: cephx secret to use for monitor authentication :type: secret: str :param hostname: hostname of the local unit :type hostname: str :param path: full path to ceph mon directory :type path: str :param done: full path to 'done' marker for ceph mon :type done: str :param init_marker: full path to 'init' marker for ceph mon :type init_marker: str """ if cmp_pkgrevno('ceph', '14.0.0') >= 0: systemd_unit = 'ceph-mon@{}'.format(socket.gethostname()) else: systemd_unit = 'ceph-mon' subprocess.check_call(['systemctl', 'enable', systemd_unit]) service_restart(systemd_unit) @retry_on_exception(3, base_delay=5) def _create_keyrings(): """Create keyrings for operation of ceph-mon units :raises: Exception if keyrings cannot be created """ if cmp_pkgrevno('ceph', '14.0.0') >= 0: # NOTE(jamespage): At Nautilus, keys are created by the # monitors automatically and just need # exporting. output = str(subprocess.check_output( [ 'sudo', '-u', ceph_user(), 'ceph', '--name', 'mon.', '--keyring', '/var/lib/ceph/mon/ceph-{}/keyring'.format( socket.gethostname() ), 'auth', 'get', 'client.admin', ]).decode('UTF-8')).strip() if not output: # NOTE: key not yet created, raise exception and retry raise Exception write_file(_client_admin_keyring, output, owner=ceph_user(), group=ceph_user(), perms=0o400) else: # NOTE(jamespage): Later ceph releases require explicit # call to ceph-create-keys to setup the # admin keys for the cluster; this command # will wait for quorum in the cluster before # returning. # NOTE(fnordahl): Explicitly run `ceph-create-keys` for older # ceph releases too. This improves bootstrap # resilience as the charm will wait for # presence of peer units before attempting # to bootstrap. Note that charms deploying # ceph-mon service should disable running of # `ceph-create-keys` service in init system. cmd = ['ceph-create-keys', '--id', socket.gethostname()] if cmp_pkgrevno('ceph', '12.0.0') >= 0: # NOTE(fnordahl): The default timeout in ceph-create-keys of 600 # seconds is not adequate. Increase timeout when # timeout parameter available. For older releases # we rely on retry_on_exception decorator. # LP#1719436 cmd.extend(['--timeout', '1800']) subprocess.check_call(cmd) osstat = os.stat(_client_admin_keyring) if not osstat.st_size: # NOTE(fnordahl): Retry will fail as long as this file exists. # LP#1719436 os.remove(_client_admin_keyring) raise Exception if bluestore: elif cmp_pkgrevno('ceph', '12.1.0') >= 0 and not bluestore: # NOTE(lathiat): when config_changed runs on reboot, the OSD might not # yet be mounted or started, and the underlying directory the OSD is # mounted to is expected to be owned by root. So skip the check. This # may also happen for OSD directories for OSDs that were removed. if (service == 'osd' and not os.path.exists(os.path.join(child, 'magic'))): continue ('mimic', 'nautilus'), 'train': 'nautilus',
deleted_lines: def is_bootstrapped():def bootstrap_monitor_cluster(secret): add_keyring_to_ceph(keyring, secret, hostname, path, done, init_marker) @retry_on_exception(3, base_delay=5) def add_keyring_to_ceph(keyring, secret, hostname, path, done, init_marker): subprocess.check_call(['systemctl', 'enable', 'ceph-mon']) service_restart('ceph-mon') # NOTE(jamespage): Later ceph releases require explicit # call to ceph-create-keys to setup the # admin keys for the cluster; this command # will wait for quorum in the cluster before # returning. # NOTE(fnordahl): Explicitly run `ceph-crate-keys` for older # ceph releases too. This improves bootstrap # resilience as the charm will wait for # presence of peer units before attempting # to bootstrap. Increase timeout when # timeout parameter available. subject: Ensure timeout on queueing transaction
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-22 12:47:27.000000000', 'files': ['ovsdbapp/tests/unit/backend/ovs_idl/test_connection.py', 'ovsdbapp/tests/functional/schema/open_vswitch/test_impl_idl.py', 'ovsdbapp/backend/ovs_idl/connection.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ovsdbapp/commit/8753843ab54897ad42f66c4d0531e7644498693f', 'message': 'Ensure timeout on queueing transaction

If idl.run() somehow throws an Exception, the existing code
would cause the Connection thread to die and then if more than
one transaction was queued, it would hang forever. Instead, we
enforce timeout on queing a transaction and log the exception
that happens in the Connection thread to make debugging easier
and try reconnecting on the off chance that the exception is
recoverable.

Change-Id: I14313df9a59424787230b3fbd630d925323969fe
(cherry picked from commit c3d639ab45f827a19429d107f373fdbd555b4bfb)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure timeout on queueing transaction

If idl.run() somehow throws an Exception, the existing code
would cause the Connection thread to die and then if more than
one transaction was queued, it would hang forever. Instead, we
enforce timeout on queing a transaction and log the exception
that happens in the Connection thread to make debugging easier
and try reconnecting on the off chance that the exception is
recoverable.

Change-Id: I14313df9a59424787230b3fbd630d925323969fe
(cherry picked from commit c3d639ab45f827a19429d107f373fdbd555b4bfb)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ovsdbapp refs/changes/04/678004/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import loggingfrom ovsdbapp import exceptionsLOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) errors = 0 # If we fail on a run() call, we could have missed an update # from the server, leaving us out of sync with ovsdb-server. # It is not safe to continue without restarting the connection, # though it is likely that the error is unrecoverable, so only try # a few times before bailing completely. try: self.idl.run() except Exception as e: # This shouldn't happen, but is possible if there is a bug # in python-ovs errors += 1 LOG.exception(e) if errors <= 3: self.idl.force_reconnect() idlutils.wait_for_change(self.idl, self.timeout) continue self._is_running = False break errors = 0 try: self.txns.put(txn, timeout=self.timeout) except Queue.Full: raise exceptions.TimeoutException(commands=txn.commands, timeout=self.timeout)

subject: Set CephEnableDashboard to false
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-23 09:17:08.000000000', 'files': ['ci/environments/scenario001-standalone.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/d12fc53b3ee2938ed5bf571259b372d973f8e9cb', 'message': "Set CephEnableDashboard to false

As per https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673675/ commit added in
stein disables the CephEnableDashboard in order to fix
'you must add a [grafana-server] group and add at least one node'
error but in standalone scenario1 , it is enabled by default.

Setting it to false fixes the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1838460

Change-Id: Idd52b6a74b15314c0f75c24ba8c40f467b003fcc
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Set CephEnableDashboard to false

As per https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673675/ commit added in
stein disables the CephEnableDashboard in order to fix
'you must add a [grafana-server] group and add at least one node'
error but in standalone scenario1 , it is enabled by default.

Setting it to false fixes the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1838460

Change-Id: Idd52b6a74b15314c0f75c24ba8c40f467b003fcc
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Tripleo job template restructuring

Implement new templates to be used by tripleo jobs so we can easily
control what runs without having to touch lots of repositories.

The new templates should also avoid accidental enablement of multibranch
jobs on branched repositories.

Change-Id: I6c307b83ccb42defe147f9705e65f2326d067628
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/667423

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-19 06:49:58.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/i18n.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/6abd44500f3cfce4f74204b77b0e92ecb0d8c4a2', 'message': 'Fix translated response

When request has ``Accept-Language`` header, keystone should response
the translated message. Without oslo_i18n lazy translation feature, the
message will be translated before the server knows the language.

Actually this has been fixed previously, like
2167e3612cbb79003cc0b8a98607f346238d7be4

But seems the logic was broken after i18n refactor.

Change-Id: Icb3d9dcd25a5dde0676fc4bd4eaad7b265a0c99d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix translated response

When request has ``Accept-Language`` header, keystone should response
the translated message. Without oslo_i18n lazy translation feature, the
message will be translated before the server knows the language.

Actually this has been fixed previously, like
2167e3612cbb79003cc0b8a98607f346238d7be4

But seems the logic was broken after i18n refactor.

Change-Id: Icb3d9dcd25a5dde0676fc4bd4eaad7b265a0c99d

commit_message:
Adds log_filters parameter to nova::compute::libvirt

Defines a filter to select a different logging level
for a given category log outputs, as specified in
https://libvirt.org/logging.html. Default undef

Change-Id: Ic48afe856ae60654d6cebf627b12509881933c59
Related-Bug: #1840140
(cherry picked from commit 0b0bd400659e5e545173417816ec346249f4860e)
(cherry picked from commit 749e4fbb25d71fb04883bb70f61676cca71df6de)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/98/677998/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*log_filters*] # (optional) Defines a filter to select a different logging level # for a given category log outputs, as specified in # https://libvirt.org/logging.html # Defaults to undef # $log_filters = undef, if $log_filters { libvirtd_config { 'log_filters': value => "\"${log_filters}\""; } }

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Also fix the CI failure due to:
https://docs.python.org/3/whatsnew/3.5.html#pep-479-change-stopiteration-handling-inside-generators

Change-Id: Ica582f99730c5019a1212d4f58d7d854ad2996fd
Story: #2005924
Task: #34254

commit_message:

Sometimes mgr dashboard enablement fails with following message:
"Error ENOENT: all mgr daemons do not support module 'dashboard',
pass --force to force enablement"

Change-Id: Ie7052dbdccb855e02da849dbc207b5d1778e2c82
(cherry picked from commit 361f61d4a9fe91a138c21e0a51f54c5e52d83aaa)

commit_message:
Fix default value for possible missing scope_id inside a DataFrame

Since DataFrame/DataPoint implementation patch we cannot guarantee
anymore that a DataFrame does contain a scope_id therefore
the __UNDEF__ default value has been retained to maintain
backward compatibility if it would occur being absent

Change-Id: I77d522c71a319eb569c0d9ef055b4d973143c519
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty refs/changes/74/678174/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(jferrieu): Since DataFrame/DataPoint # implementation patch we cannot guarantee # anymore that a DataFrame does contain a scope_id # therefore the __UNDEF__ default value has been # retained to maintain backward compatibility # if it would occur being absent frame_tenant = point.desc.get(scope_key, '__UNDEF__')

commit_message:
Fix listing security groups when no rules

When listing security groups in the dashboard and
one or more security groups had no rules it failed
because python throws a KeyError.

This commit changes the neutron API wrapper in horizon
to ensure ensure rule information in SG always exists.

Closes-Bug: #1840465
Co-Authored-By: Tobias Urdin <tobias.urdin@binero.se>
Change-Id: I6e05a7dc6b6655514ee2bff6bd327da86f13900a
(cherry picked from commit cdb191ec83f86dffade56be07ca53077d7c78b14)

commit_message:
Change masakari-dashboard release model

Since masakari-dashboard was only released once last cycle AND it has not
yet been released this cycle yet either, we propose to change it to the
cycle-with-rc model which is better for deliverables that do a single
release per cycle.

There are three options for responding:

1) If you know you will only do one release this cycle, +1.
2) If you know you will do more than one, please release now and -1
this change.
3) If you have no idea when you will release, please please please
propose one BEFORE rc1 and -1 this change.

Change-Id: I0db5c6e842570b0ca0b069f97039815f04dbc835

commit_message:
Change watcher-dashboard release model

Since watcher-dashboard was only released once last cycle AND it has not
yet been released this cycle yet either, we propose to change it to the
cycle-with-rc model which is better for deliverables that do a single
release per cycle.

There are three options for responding:

1) If you know you will only do one release this cycle, +1.
2) If you know you will do more than one, please release now and -1
this change.
3) If you have no idea when you will release, please please please
propose one BEFORE rc1 and -1 this change.

Change-Id: I2c1f136c1881e8aed66c2141a4b98263e73efb82
